title: Software Engineer II - Platform Engineering
description:
***Welcome to Warner Bros. Discovery… the stuff dreams are made of.***
**Who We Are…**
 When we say, “the stuff dreams are made of,” we’re not just referring to the world of wizards, dragons and superheroes, or even to the wonders of Planet Earth. Behind WBD’s vast portfolio of iconic content and beloved brands, are the
 *storytellers* 
 bringing our characters to life, the
 *creators* 
 bringing them to your living rooms and the
 *dreamers* 
 creating what’s next…
   

  

 From brilliant creatives, to technology trailblazers, across the globe, WBD offers career defining opportunities, thoughtfully curated benefits, and the tools to explore and grow into your best selves. Here you are supported, here you are celebrated, here you can thrive.
   

  

 Warner Bros. has been entertaining audiences for more than 90 years through the world’s most-loved characters and franchises. Warner Bros. employs people all over the world in a wide variety of disciplines. We're always on the lookout for energetic, creative people to join our team.
   

  

**Your New Role...**
 The Direct to Consumer (DTC) Group is a technology company within Warner Bros Discovery. We are building a global streaming video platform (OTT), and a suite of applications to support all of our network’s brands globally. We are building modern container-based micro-services operated on AWS. Our platform covers everything from search, catalogue, video transcoding, personalization, to global subscriptions, and really much more. We build user experiences ranging from classic lean-back viewing to interactive learning applications.  We build for connected TVs, web, mobile phones, tablets, and consoles for a large footprint of WBD owned networks including Max, Eurosport discovery+ and many more. This is a growing, global engineering group crucial to WBD’s future.
   

  

 We are hiring a Software Engineer II within the DTC Operational Engineering group with focus on Cluster Engineering. The team is dedicated to provide a secure, efficient and easy-to-use container runtime platform. We build automation for expanding it to new markets, tenants and geographical regions, bootstrapping a fully featured container runtime ready for back-end development teams to use.
   

  

 We team up with other platform teams, manage the lifecycle of critical platform components and work closely with SRE to improve reliability and efficiency of the platform. We provide strategies and processes for lifecycle management of the container runtime environment. We own critical components, assess when we should introduce new ones and set the bar for quality. We focus on reducing security incidents while ensuring cost-effectiveness and supporting the business needs.
   

  

**Your Role Accountabilities...**
 Responsibilities include, but are not limited to, operating Kubernetes clusters (version upgrades and managing critical Kubernetes components like Karpenter), security vulnerability mitigations (rolling out security patches to Kubernetes nodes) and cost optimizations (scaling of our thousands of servers running hundreds of in-house built services, supporting millions of customers across the globe).
   

  

* As a Software Engineer II on the team, you will work with Kubernetes cluster operational tasks like upgrading the Kubernetes version. This includes performing an analysis of what is changing in the new version and how it affects the workload running on each cluster, e.g. deprecated k8s APIs and controller compatibility.
* You’ll use tools to scan clusters for finding things that needs remediation, define actions for it, as well as executing them.
* As part of rolling out upgrades to hundreds of clusters, some ranging up to a thousand nodes, you will identify automation opportunities to reduce the amount of toil needed.
* To keep the runtime infrastructure secure you will roll out security patches to Kubernetes nodes (EC2 AMI updates) on a regular basis (PCI compliance demands new patches to be installed at least every 30 days) and help improve the automation tooling to eventually run this on an automated schedule.
* In order to keep our runtime cost low, you will take part in cost optimization efforts, like tweaking the Karpenter node scaling strategies, increasing the bin-packing efficiency of pods on nodes, ensuring the right node family type is used (m, c, r, spot and Graviton/ARM) and identifying over scaled infrastructure.
* To enable faster time to new markets and onboarding of new tenants to our streaming platform, you’ll work on automating the creation of new Kubernetes clusters together with bootstrapping of critical platform capabilities like service mesh, deployment systems and the observability stack (metrics, tracing, logging).


**Qualifications And Experience...**
* At least 1-2 years of Kubernetes experience.
* At least 1-2 years of AWS experience.
* At least 2-3 years of software development, infrastructure management or operations experience.
* Ability to write code for automation in python, bash or golang.
* Experience with designing infrastructure CI/CD pipelines, e.g. Jenkins or GitHub Actions.
* Experience with IaC, preferably Terraform.
* Used to Helm templating for k8s manifests.
* Understanding of how GitOps tooling like ArgoCD or Flux works.
* Experience in rolling out infrastructure changes to production by following a change management workflow.
* Knowing what metrics to monitor during a change rollout to identify problems.
* Strong ownership mentality during rollouts, stop/rollback and fix if problems occur or escalate to management/on-call if getting stuck.
* Strong sense of security, always using least privileges access and firewall configurations when needed for maintenance.
* Understanding of how running workloads on the Kubernetes clusters may be affected by cluster changes or node rotations.
* Willingness to talk to service development teams and understand their challenges when they report problems during maintenance windows.
* Ability to define and measure KPIs and honor SLAs for infrastructure maintenance.
* Experience with Git and GitHub PR workflows.
* Experience in working with Agile – Sprints, Epics/Stories, Jira.


**How We Get Things Done…**
 This last bit is probably the most important! Here at WBD, our guiding principles are the core values by which we operate and are central to how we get things done. You can find them at www.wbd.com/guiding-principles/ along with some insights from the team on what they mean and how they show up in their day to day. We hope they resonate with you and look forward to discussing them during your interview.
   

  

**Championing Inclusion at WBD**
 Warner Bros. Discovery embraces the opportunity to build a workforce that reflects the diversity of our society and the world around us. Being an equal opportunity employer means that we take seriously our responsibility to consider qualified candidates on the basis of merit, regardless of sex, gender identity, ethnicity, age, sexual orientation, religion or belief, marital status, pregnancy, parenthood, disability or any other category protected by law.
   

  

 If you’re a qualified candidate with a disability and you require adjustments or accommodations during the job application and/or recruitment process, please visit our accessibility page for instructions to submit your request.

title: Mobile SDK Developer
description:
**About Sinch**
 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**Description**
 We are a forward-thinking team creating cutting-edge, cloud-based communication solutions. Our mobile client SDKs are key to how our customers integrate their products with our platform. We have clients ranging from small businesses to large enterprises, and their mobile apps are used by millions of people worldwide. By developing our voice and video SDKs together with the team, you will play a pivotal role in powering all those real-time conversations.
   

  

**Role**
 As a Mobile SDK Engineer, you'll take ownership of developing and maintaining high-performing mobile SDKs while contributing to all stages of the software lifecycle. In this role, you will:
   

  

* Develop SDKs using WebRTC technology to optimize real-time communication features.
* Work with the team to align SDK APIs and features across multiple platforms, including iOS, Android, and Web/JavaScript.
* Develop cross-platform solutions using a C++ codebase shared between iOS and Android.
* Design APIs with simplicity in mind while maintaining modularity, extensibility, and API stability over time.
* Write clean, testable, and maintainable code, with a focus on system performance and scalability.
* Enhance automation, streamline CI/CD pipelines, and troubleshoot issues proactively.
* Influence architectural decisions and actively contribute to enhancing our development and operational practices.


**Requirements**
* Professional expertise in modern C++, especially in mobile applications development.
* Professional experience developing for the iOS and/or Android platform.
* Experience with at least one of Kotlin or Objective-C/Swift.
* Experience working in Linux/macOS development environments and CI pipelines.
* Strong communication skills and a collaborative mindset.
* A passion for clean, testable code and modern software practices.


**Good to have**
* Experience with WebRTC protocols and NAT traversal, including ICE, STUN, and TURN, is a significant advantage.
* Experience developing software libraries and/or SDKs consumed by other developers.
* In-depth knowledge of network protocols such as IP, TCP, UDP, and DNS.
* Great debugging and troubleshooting skills.


 Embrace the challenge and join us! You will have the chance to:
   

  

* Work with a talented and diverse team in a culture that values innovation and collaboration.
* Take on meaningful challenges and grow with the latest technologies.
* Enjoy flexibility with hybrid work options and a healthy work-life balance.
* Benefit from competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits package, including healthcare insurance, pension contributions, and wellness allowance.


**Our Hiring Process**
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
   

  

 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: . No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: Senior Business Intelligence Developer
description:
Support MSTR Sea team's report development capacity (regular deliveries) to free up capacity for critical deliveries for MSTR platform optimization and migration IO, requiring more senior expertise.

 Covers all MSTR projects, suppoting wide range of stakeholders. Part of TDA R&V Emic roadmap.

title: Full Stack Developer & Startup Founder (March 2025)
job_function: Information Technology, Business Development, and Strategy/Planning
company_industry: Venture Capital and Private Equity Principals
description:
**Note: This Opportunity Does Not Offer Employment, but rather an opportunity to build your own VC-backed startup!** 




  





**Who you are:** 




 You are a highly accomplished full-stack software developer with a demonstrated ability to deliver innovative solutions. Your exceptional programming skills and experience in building complex applications position you to tackle significant challenges within the tech industry. You possess a strong problem-solving aptitude and a passion for pioneering cutting-edge technologies. Driven to make a real impact, you're eager to leverage your expertise in building disruptive tech ventures.
 



  





**About Antler** 




 Antler is the world's most active venture capital firm, providing funding from pre-seed to Series C. We invest in Founders who seek to define our tomorrow and reshape the world we live in with groundbreaking technological innovation. Every year, we handpick the strongest Founders from more than 135,000 applicants across our 27 locations on the globe, which has led us to work with more than 7,000 founders to date and a portfolio of more than 1,000 startups.
 



  





**The Antler Founder Residency** 




 Join a dynamic cohort of 200+ highly motivated entrepreneurs for an immersive 12-week program. Visit our website for a detailed breakdown of how we'll support your startup launch.
 


* 12-Week full-time Immersive Journey: Kicking off March, 2025, in Stockholm.
* Co-Founder Discovery: In the first 10 weeks, collaborate with fellow Founders to find your co-founder(s).
* Pitch to Invest: Present your team and business idea to the Antler Investment Committee. Secure a net cash investment of EUR 100k for 10% equity.
* Accelerate Growth: If funded, we work closely with you to make your startup a success



  





**Program Details** 



* **Start Date:** 
 March 3rd, 2025
* **Location:** 
 Onsite at our Stockholm office
* **Compensation:** 
 While participants don't receive financial compensation during the program, pre-seed investment is available to jumpstart your venture.
* **Visa Sponsorship:** 
 Due to the non-employment nature of the program, visa sponsorship is unavailable.



  





**For our March 2025 cohort, we’re looking for someone who:** 



* Having the autonomy to develop sophisticated software solutions to address real-world challenges, merging ingenuity with functionality.
* Exceptional problem-solving and analytical skills, capable of breaking down complex issues and bringing structure into business cases
* Providing leadership, whether it’s directing a development team or managing comprehensive product delivery.
* You have an idea that you believe can solve a problem you are deeply interested in. You understand that you need co-pilots who share your vision and values.



  





**Application Process** 




 Our streamlined application process takes only 2-3 weeks:
 


1. Apply through our website.
2. Participate in an introductory interview.
3. Progress to an in-depth interview with our partners.
4. Receive a potential offer.



  





**Antler Success Stories** 




 Several companies built through the Antler program have received pre-seed investment and have gone on to secure significant funding rounds. Here are just a few examples:
 


* **Wingbits:** 
 A community-driven flight data tracking platform
* **Two:** 
 A comprehensive B2B payment suite simplifying sales for online and offline businesses.
* **Evyon:** 
 A developer of eco-friendly battery energy storage systems.
* **Glint Solar:** 
 Software accelerating the identification of optimal solar installation sites.
* **PerPlant:** 
 AI-powered sensor systems creating a gateway to sustainable agriculture.

title: Senior Java developer
description:
**Är du en erfaren Javautvecklare som söker nya utmaningar?**
 Hos B3 Innovation får du möjligheten att arbeta i en miljö där innovation och samarbete står i fokus. Vi söker dig med djup kunskap inom Java och som trivs i en dynamisk och inkluderande arbetsmiljö.
   

  

**Om rollen som Javautvecklare på B3 Innovation**
 Som utvecklare hos oss kommer du att:
   

  

* Utveckla högkvalitativa och skalbara lösningar.
* Samarbeta med ett tvärfunktionellt team av experter.
* Delta i design och arkitektur av nya system.


**Om dig**
 Vi söker dig som har god erfarenhet och arbetat som utvecklare under en längre tid. Du som har hunnit både göra misstag och även lära av dem. Förhoppningsvis tycker du om att arbeta i team, dela med dig av dina kunskaper och vill fortsätta att lära dig nytt.
   

  

 Våra krav för att du ska passa i denna roll:
   

  

* Du behärskar svenska i tal och skrift.
* Du har minst 5 års erfarenhet av Javautveckling.
* Du har god kunskap att jobba med Java, Kotlin, Spring, Microservices (gärna i CI/CD-miljö)
* Du har god kunskap att jobba med olika ramverk som React, Angular och Vue.
* Du har ett öga för detaljer och brinner för att leverera kvalitativa lösningar.
* Du är bekväm med moderna utvecklingsmetoder som Agile och DevOps.
* Har du dessutom kunskaper inom Techlead blir vi extra glada!


 Varför B3 Innovation?
   

  

* Innovativ Kultur: Vi uppmuntrar kreativitet och nya idéer.
* Inkluderande miljö: Vi värdesätter mångfald och strävar efter en arbetsplats där alla känner sig välkomna.
* Balans och flexibilitet: Flexibilitet är centralt, vilket gör att du kan forma din arbetsdag för att få livspusslet att gå ihop. Vi förstår vikten av balans mellan arbete och fritid och erbjuder därför flexibla arbetstider.
* Gemenskap: Hos oss blir du en del av ett stöttande team som arbetar tillsammans för att nå gemensamma mål. Det handlar inte bara om “jobb jobb jobb” hos oss. Vi anordnar allt från tech-workshops till sociala aktiviteter som stickcaféer, spelkvällar och AW.


**Om B3 Innovation**
 Vi är kända för vårt fokus på innovation och förmåga att leverera värde till våra kunder. Genom att kombinera djup teknisk expertis med en stark förståelse för våra kunders verksamhet, skapar vi lösningar som verkligen gör skillnad. Vår kultur bygger på öppenhet, samarbete och en passion för teknik.
   

  

 Vi prioriterar personlig utveckling och erbjuder verktyg som B3 Academy, TechTalks och "Lunch & Learn" för att du ska kunna växa.
   

  

 Upptäck möjligheterna med B3 Innovation. Som utvecklare får du arbeta inom spännande branscher som media, bank och finans, energi, offentlig sektor, telekom och e-handel. Oavsett om du optimerar TV-sändningar, utvecklar digitala banktjänster eller skapar smarta hem, hjälper vi dig att hitta det perfekta uppdraget som matchar dina intressen.
   

  

 Våra toppbetyg i medarbetarundersökningar visar att nöjda kollegor är kärnan i vår framgång. Är du redo att kliva in i en miljö där utveckling och trivsel går hand i hand?
   

  

 Som sagt, välkommen till B3 Innovation – vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
   

  

**Är du redo att ta nästa steg?**
 Skicka in din ansökan idag och bli en del av vårt engagerade och innovativa team!
   

  

 Om du är mer nyfiken på oss så kan du läsa mer om oss här: https://www.b3.se/innovation
   

  

 Om du har funderingar så hör gärna av dig till Kenneth Andersson på +46706678050 alternativt mail kenneth.andersson@b3.se

title: Applikationsutvecklare till StrongPoint E-Commerce
description:
*Drivs du av att skapa innovativa lösningar som gör skillnad? På StrongPoint får du chansen att utveckla teknologi som förändrar butiksvärlden och förbättrar shoppingupplevelsen för kunder globalt. Vi söker nu en passionerad applikationsutvecklare som vill vara en del av vårt engagerade team och bidra till framtidens digitala handel!*
**Din roll**
 Som Applikationsutvecklare hos StrongPoint ansvarar du för att utveckla och underhålla mobilapplikationer som används världen över. Ditt fokus ligger på att skapa användarvänliga, robusta och säkra appar med hjälp av C# och .NET.
   

  

 Du arbetar nära vårt utvecklingsteam i Täby och Baltikum, där ni tillsammans säkerställer kvalitet och användarvänlighet i våra applikationer. Från idé till lansering är du en central del av utvecklingsprocessen och bidrar till att förbättra våra lösningar inom orderplock för dagligvaruhandeln.
   

  

 Hos oss blir du en del av ett dynamiskt team av problemlösare som drivs av teknik och innovation. Vi värdesätter kompetensutbyte, samarbete och att alltid ligga i framkant. Arbetskulturen präglas av positivitet, nytänkande och en vilja att utvecklas tillsammans.
   

  

 Rollen är placerad i Täby med möjlighet till visst distansarbete. Du rapporterar till R&D Manager E-com Tech.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Vi söker dig som har en stark känsla för kvalitet och en vilja att utvecklas. Du har ett stort driv, är en lagspelare med en positiv attityd och håller dig ständigt uppdaterad inom den senaste tekniken. Du har erfarenhet av mobilapplikationsutveckling samt expertis inom C# och .NET. Vidare ser vi att du behärskar svenska och engelska flytande i både tal och skrift och har en relevant teknisk utbildning eller motsvarande erfarenhet.
   

  

 Det är meriterande om du har:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av cross-platform mobilutveckling med Xamarin.Forms och/eller .NET MAUI
* Kunskap om distribution och signering för Apple/Google-projekt
* Erfarenhet av Azure DevOps och CI/CD-processer
* Förståelse för design- och arkitekturmönster (ex. mediator, MVVM)
* Erfarenhet av att använda RESTful API


 Om StrongPoint
   

  

 StrongPoint är ett ledande företag inom butiksteknologi som utvecklar lösningar och tjänster för att göra butiker smartare, shoppingupplevelsen bättre och e-handel med mat mer effektiv. Vi är verksamma i över 25 länder och har i mer än 35 år hjälpt dagligvaruhandlare att öka sin produktivitet, sänka kostnader och skapa effektivitetsvinster. Bolaget har sitt huvudkontor i Norge, har över 500 anställda och är börsnoterat på Oslobörsen under STRONG. Läs mer om oss här: https://www.strongpoint.com/se/om-oss/
   

  

**Kontakt och ansökan**
 I denna rekrytering samarbetar StrongPoint med Wise IT. Vid frågor om tjänsten, kontakta ansvarig rekryteringskonsult Alexandra Karlsson på alexandra.karlsson@wiseit.se. Observera att vi inte tar emot ansökningar via e-post.
   

  

 Urval och intervjuer sker löpande – skicka in din ansökan redan idag!
   

  

 Välkommen att bli en del av StrongPoint!

title: Senior JavaScript Engineer
description:
**About Us**
**At FDJ UNITED, we don't just follow the game, we reinvent it.**
 FDJ UNITED is one of Europe’s leading betting and gaming operators, with a vast portfolio of iconic brands and a reputation for technological excellence. With more than 5,000 employees and a presence in around fifteen regulated markets, the Group offers a diversified, responsible range of games, both under exclusive rights and open to competition. We set new standards, proving that entertainment and safety can go hand in hand. Here, you’ll work alongside a team of passionate individuals dedicated to delivering the best and safest entertaining experiences for our customers every day.
   

  

 We’re looking for bold people who are eager to succeed and ready to level-up the game. If you thrive on innovation, embrace challenges, and want to make a real impact at all levels, FDJ UNITED is your playing field.
   

  

**Join us in shaping the future of gaming. Are you ready to LEVEL-UP THE GAME?**
 Senior Software Engineer, JavaScript
   

  

**The role**
 We are looking for a passionate
 **Multiple Senior Frontend Engineers** 
 with experience working in React and JavaScript. As a member of a Cross-Functional team within the Gaming or Payment area and , you'll be responsible for designing and implementing the user interface of our web applications and integrating against the back end via REST APIs. You'll also be collaborating closely with Product Owner, other front-end developers, Architects and the rest of the team members to deliver high quality, scalable and user-friendly software solutions across different platforms.
   

  

 You will participate in design discussions with your colleagues to find great solutions to complex engineering challenges. We strongly believe in the “You Design it, You Build It, You Test It, You Run It, You Tweak It” ethos and everyone is expected to take part of the full system / development life cycle to ensure reliability and uptime of the production environment.
   

  

  

  

**Our technology stack includes**
* JavaScript and React
* CSS, UI libraries and HTML
* REST APIs
* CI/CD using Jenkins
* Micro frontend architecture
* Cypress E2E and Component Testing
* State management with Redux or similar


  

  

**To excel in this role, we believe you…**
* Have commercial experience working as a Senior Frontend Developer/Engineer, with great skills in JavaScript and React/Redux
* Have great communication skills
* Team player, has worked in an Agile team and familiar with Scrum, Kanban or similar frameworks.
* Are proficient with CSS, HTML and UI libraries.
* Have experience releasing components to production and keeping them up to date with appropriate versioning.
* Have experience in integrations with REST-API's
* Enjoy having full ownership of your work and the SDLC including using appropriate testing techniques such as unit testing & integration testing.
* Have experience implementing CI/CD practices such as git branching, automated tests and automated deployment pipelines
* Are able to investigate, troubleshoot and solve production issues, or having previous experience working as an Incident Manager
* Have good appreciation of TDD/BDD
* Have good understanding of React Hooks
* Typescript, Node JS and A/B Testing experiences are a big plus
* Service workers experience is a plus
* Ensure that you adhere to the Governance, Risk & Compliance (GRC) obligations for your role.
* Identify and raise any non-compliance incidents promptly to your line manager.
* Challenge processes, policies and projects that will negatively impact compliance within the Group.
* Complete all mandatory compliance training assigned to you.
* Reach out to the Compliance Teams if unsure of any of your compliance obligations or the requirements are unclear.


 Our Way Of Working
   

  

 Our world is hybrid.
   

  

 A career is not a sprint. It’s a marathon. One of the perks of joining us is that we value you as a person first. Our hybrid world allows you to focus on your goals and responsibilities and lets you self-organise to improve your deliveries and get the work done in your own way.
   

  

 Application Process
   

  

 We believe talent knows no boundaries. Our hiring process focuses solely on your skills, experience, and potential to contribute to our team. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds and evaluate each candidate based on merit, regardless of personal characteristics as the age, gender, origin, religion, sexual orientation, neurodiversity or disability.

title: Mobile iOS Developer
description:
Do you have a passion for mobile application development and IoT? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you. The Digital and Access Solutions (DAS) business segment within the EMEIA Division is looking for a Mobile iOS Developer to join the Wireless Lock product unit, based in Stockholm, Sweden. You'll be part of a collaborative culture that empowers you to build a career you can be proud of.
   

  

**What You Would Do As Our Mobile IOS Developer**
 You would develop applications for configuration and operations of our wireless locks and systems. You will join a cross functional agile software team with mobile and cloud developers, QAs and a UX designer. You will work closely with our firmware team regarding communication with the devices. On top of this you will cooperate with product management on the app requirements.
   

  

**You Would Also**
* Contribute to planning activities by analyzing requirements, make specifications and break down implementation work (epics and stories).
* Investigate and resolve customer-reported issues.
* Take part in end user testing activities.
* Continuously discover, evaluate, and implement new technologies.


**The Skills And Experience You Need**
 We are looking for someone who has:
   

  

* A minimum of 3 years of experience in iOS app development, mainly with Swift.
* Experience with RESTful APIs and integration with cloud services.
* Experience with git, continuous integration and delivery practices.
* Strong command of written and spoken English.
* Technical education in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or similar. Bachelor's degree or higher preferred.


 Ideally, you have experience working with several of the following – development of mobile applications for connected IoT devices, BLE communication, Swift UI, APIs for offline storage, threading and performance tuning, security technologies such as TLS, Keychain, MFA, OAuth and PKI, iOS development, cross platform languages such as React native (expo), Kotlin multi-platform or Flutter, SAFe agile methodology. I addition, you share our belief in lean and agile values, with an open mind set, cross-functional teams, where many competences are working together for successful projects.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 We’re passionate about providing amazing opportunities and benefits, so you can continue and progress a lifelong career with us – here’s what we have to offer:
   

  

* Learning and career development opportunities, whether it’s online learning, management training or enhancing your skills.
* A competitive salary and incentive schemes.
* The opportunity to grow your skills in a versatile way and develop your career in a respected global group.
* Agile and innovative working environment.
* Motivated and encouraging team around you.
* Stable employment in a friendly international atmosphere
* Hybrid working model with minimum of 2 office days per week


**We review applications regularly, so don't wait**
 We are building diverse, inclusive teams, and encourage applications from everyone who can see themselves working with us. Just set up your profile and apply here.
   

  

 To make sure your personal data is safe, we don’t look at any applications sent by email or post. If you have any questions about the role or the process, email Mona Yusefi, Talent Acquisition Business Partner, at mona.yusefi@assaabloy.com.
   

  

 Depending on the risk profile for the role, a background screening will need to be performed. Final candidates may therefore be a subject to a background screening. The performance of a background check is subject to consent and based on our Applicant Privacy Notice.
   

  

 Let’s create a safer and more open world - together!
   

  

 To find out more about us, visit www.assaabloy.com

title: AI Developer
description:
**Zimply** 
 is on a mission to unlock value through cutting-edge AI-driven products. That’s why they’ve developed AI assistants to enhance workflows and handle repetitive tasks across various industries. By leveraging AI-powered assistants, Zimply empowers people to focus on what truly matters—enhancing efficiency, productivity, and innovation.
 



  





 Today, Zimply has over 70 customers, with their AI products assisting with accounting, order processing, chatbot services, and more.
 



  





 We are now looking for an AI Developer to help Zimply shape the future of AI-powered products. If you have a passion for AI and product development, along with solid experience in Python, we want to hear from you!
 



  





**About the Role** 




 As the AI Developer, you’ll play a key role in being part of a team leading the design, architecture and development of their next-generation AI solutions, with a particular focus on technologies like Python, Automation, Prompt Engineering and LLM (Large Language Models).
 



  





**You will:** 



* Collaborate closely with the CTO and Head of Development on research and design to create a scalable architecture and code for the next-generation AI-driven products.
* Work hands-on and guide the tech team in implementing AI solutions in Python, focusing on areas like natural language processing, chatbot development, and intelligent automation.
* Develop and integrate tools and frameworks that improve AI product capabilities
* Collaborate closely with the team to ensure high quality and operational reliability in the solutions, both technically and functionally.



  





**About you** 




 We believe you are a structured person who likes to take initiative. You have great organizational and problem-solving skills, and thrive in an entrepreneurial, fast-paced environment. You enjoy working in a close-knit team towards shared goals and want to grow together with your colleagues and the company.
 



  





**To thrive and succeed in this role, we believe you have:** 



* Solid experience in Python development, minimum 5 years.
* Deep understanding of architectural issues and experience with solution architecture
* Experience developing LLMs (Large Language Models) and prompt engineering
* Experience with test automation tools, such as Selenium, Playwright, Robocorp or Cypress.
* Fluent English, both spoken and written



  





**It’s a plus if you have:** 



* Experience in fine-tuning LLMs
* Knowledge in Machine Learning and its applications
* Cloud experience, e.g., Azure, GCP, or AWS
* Experience working with Python orchestration tools
* Have leadership ambitions and eventually want to take on a leadership role
* Experience in Intelligent Automation, such as RPA (Robotic Process Automation), computer vision, and IDP (Intelligent Document Processing)
* Have fluent skills in Swedish, both spoken and written



  





**Why Zimply?** 




 At Zimply you’ll have the opportunity to work with exciting technology and be part of an innovative team driven by a passion for automation and AI. You will join a dynamic work environment where you can grow alongside the company and dedicated colleagues, working together to create solutions that drive meaningful impact.
 


* Competitive salary
* Wellness allowance of SEK 5,000 per year
* Pension and Private Health insurance
* Flexible working hours
* Possibility to be eligible for stock options
* Offices in central Stockholm or Gothenburg



  





 For this recruitment, Zimply is working with Safemind as a recruitment partner.

title: Developer Radio SW Lab
description:
Join our Team
   

  

**About this opportunity:**
 Radio Unit Software drives the end-to-end research and development of Ericsson’s radio products and solutions.
   

  

 We are a global organization, within Radio & Transport Engineering, with engineers and developers collaborating across sites in Canada, China, Croatia, Poland, and Sweden to drive Ericsson’s strategy of securing our market leadership in radio.
   

  

 As a test environment engineer, you will be a member of our team and participate in the design of Ericsson´s next-generation radio network products!
   

  

 We have the responsibility to develop and maintain the test environment in the radio laboratory for performance testing activities.
   

  

 The role as a Laboratory Engineer will offer you opportunities to gain experience, both within the field of engineering and as a professional. This includes requirement analysis, design, integration, verification as well as Operational support of the existing environment.
   

  

**What you will do:**
* Daily operations in the laboratory and Troubleshooting
* Communicate with our users to understand new requirements
* Drive continuous improvements of products, environments, and processes.
* Develop SW/HW tools for our Radio integration and verification environments.
* Support product design with fault analysis on prototypes


**The skills you bring:**
* BSc or MSc degree in electronics or equivalent
* Programming skills in Python, Java, JavaScript, C, C++, Ruby
* Experience in development environments tools like Git, Gerrit, and Jenkins
* Knowledge about Radio RF technology and instruments
* Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills
* Embedded Software understanding and development knowledge
* You are Service minded and enjoy Working with people and networking


 You combine creativity, drive, and a sense of focus with a quality-conscious mind and that shows us that your eagerness to contribute never let you compromise your respect for others and quality.
   

  

**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 762967

title: Backend Engineer II - Test Experience
description:
We are looking for a Backend Engineer II with C++ experience to join the Test Experience team, we're looking for someone passionate about crafting the best client engineer experience.
   

  

 We strive to provide reliable test infrastructure and tools, enabling client engineers to maintain confidence in their products over time. As part of this mission, we are focused on evolving our platform by offering the necessary tooling, documentation, and guidance that allow teams to seamlessly adopt and integrate high-quality testing solutions into their workflows.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

* You will use your C++ development skills and your broad understanding of various platforms and build tools (e.g. Bazel). This also includes expertise with Window environments.
* Join a collaborative and autonomous team of engineers dedicated to improving testing for Spotify’s ecosystem.
* We focus on improving the Boost and Typescript based Test Infrastructure, which is crafted to help developers own their features entirely, including the automated tests. The infrastructure strives to reduce friction for developers by using tools and frameworks native to the product stack.
* Help craft and drive the technical roadmap of our test infrastructure, improve testing practices, and collaborate with multiple squads to ensure their needs are met. You should be comfortable navigating the challenges of test automation, debugging failures, and supporting engineers across different product areas.
* Take operational responsibility for the services that are owned by your team, potentially including taking part in an on-call rotation.
* Promote sound engineering practices, drive work on technical strategy and roadmaps.


 Who You Are
   

  

* Proficient in client-core
* Experienced with Windows, Batch and PowerShell scripting.
* Comfortable doing tasks for other clients(Android, iOS & Web) and platforms.
* Strong understanding of software architecture and design principles.
* Excellent problem-solver with keen attention to detail
* Strong communicator, able to work effectively with multi-functional teams.
* A great teammate who takes initiative and has the ability to see the bigger picture, especially when it comes to improving developer experience.
* Experienced with writing and maintaining automated tests using Boost or similar frameworks.
* Familiar with crafting scalable and maintainable testing systems and infrastructure for Core-Client.
* Interested in staying updated with the latest C++ testing tools, frameworks, and best practices.
* Comfortable collaborating with multi-functional teams, navigating technical challenges, and supporting diverse partners.
* Understanding of CI/CD pipelines and infrastructure tools like \*Bazel\*, \*Git\*, and testing frameworks for C++ is valued.


 Where You'll Be
   

  

* We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! For this role, you can be within the EMEA region as long as we have a work location \*excluding France for now due to on-call restrictions.
* This team operates within the CET/GMT time zone for collaboration.


 Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: People & Performance Manager
description:
**This is Worldline** 




 Worldline helps businesses of all shapes and sizes to accelerate their growth journey - quickly, simply, and securely. We are the innovators at the heart of the payments technology industry, shaping how the world pays and gets paid. Our technology powers the growth of millions of businesses across 5 continents. And just as we help our customers accelerate their business, we are committed to helping our people accelerate their careers. Together, we shape the evolution.
 



  





**The Opportunity** 




 We are looking for an upbeat People & Performance Manager to join our leadership team. The product domain is Digital Experience where we work closely with all customers facing digital services for Worldline. During your journey here you will get to know talented software engineering and product team based in Stockholm to help further strengthen empowered culture we strive to shape as well as contribute to their individual growth and performance. In this role you will work closely together with our Tech and Product directors in the Digital Experience leadership team.
 



  





 In this role as performance manager, you will be working with software engineers and product roles to create an environment where they can consistently meet and exceed the company standards while working towards their personal goals. This would also mean offering feedback, coaching and recognition for achievements and success. In this role you are not expected to contribute to the tech or product strategy as your product is the people performance itself.
 



  





**The team** 




 The Digital Experience team is like a football team that requires coaching to create the high performing players and a team to win the game. This is the role of the leadership team you will be part of where all of us are different type of coaches to provide either product strategy, direction for the game to play and players that can be motivated and focused to the goal of winning as a team.
 



  





**Day-to-Day Responsibilities​** 



* Establishing job functions and expectations
* Improving employee abilities through coaching and feedback
* Establishing employee behaviour patterns that align their goals with the organisations mission, values and goals
* Improving communication throughout the organisation
* Providing factual basis for management decisions regarding hiring
* Conducting the hiring process e2e
* Ensuring onboarding and mentorship structure is in place
* Setting performance objectives
* Ensuring everyone in the team is contributing best to its expectations



  





**Who Are We Looking For** 




 People who have a professional approach, being constructive and finding solutions in the best interest of the business. You are a quick learner and self-starting, showing drive and initiatives supporting business goals. A great teammate who supports their team and puts the business objectives first. You also have:
 


* Bachelor’s degree in computer science, software engineering, or another related field.
* Proven experience in people management
* Previous experience working as developer is seen as beneficial.
* Strong communication skills, with the ability to connect with both technical and non-technical colleagues.
* Strong analytical skills to effectively process and structure large amounts of information.



  





**Perks & Benefits** 




 At Worldline, you’ll get the chance to be at the heart of the global payments technology industry and shape how the world pays and gets paid. On top of that, you will also:
 


* Health contribution
* Health check – Every 2:nd year
* Private Health Care Insurance (EuroAccident)
* Parental pay and 12 months pension during parental leave
* Opportunity to hybrid working according to company standard
* Benefit portal with many great offers, plus more.



  





**Shape the evolution** 




 We are pushing towards the next frontiers of payments technology, and we look for big thinkers to join our journey. People with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. Here you’ll work with ambitious colleagues from around the world, take on unique challenges as a team, and make a real impact on the society. And with our empowering culture, strong technology and extensive training opportunities, we help you accelerate your career. Wherever you decide to go. Join our global team of over 18,000 innovators across 40+ countries, and shape a tomorrow that is yours to own.
 



  





**Learn more about life at Worldline at
 
 jobs.worldline.com**




  





**We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as an individual with a disability, or any applicable legally protected characteristics.**

title: VP of AI Research and Development, Trilogy (Remote) - $200,000/year USD
company_industry: Software Development, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Trilogy. Have you got what it takes?
   

  

 Ready to revolutionize the AI landscape? We're not just offering a job - we're offering a platform to become a pioneering voice in AI research and implementation.
   

  

 Imagine having the freedom to dive deep into AI's frontier, where your discoveries don't just end up in forgotten documents, but directly shape how enterprises implement AI solutions. As our VP of AI Research and Development, you'll be a one-person powerhouse, achieving what traditionally requires entire teams.
   

  

 This isn't your typical corporate role - it's an opportunity to become the go-to expert in AI capabilities, challenging conventional wisdom and uncovering groundbreaking approaches. Your code, experiments, and insights will influence over 150 enterprise software companies, making you a catalyst for innovation in the AI space.
   

  

 If you thrive on turning technical discoveries into practical implementations and aren't afraid to share bold insights with the world, we want to hear from you. Within a year, your name could be synonymous with cutting-edge AI expertise.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Dive into the AI frontier through hands-on coding and experimentation
* Architect and deploy sophisticated benchmarking systems to evaluate AI tools
* Create compelling technical content that transforms research into actionable insights
* Build and nurture a community of 50K+ technical professionals who value your expertise
* Challenge and verify vendor claims through rigorous proof-of-concept implementations
* Share daily discoveries through engaging blog posts and social media updates
* Develop and defend thought-provoking perspectives on AI implementation


**What You Won’t Be Doing**
* Getting bogged down in management bureaucracy or endless meetings
* Creating theoretical strategies that never see the light of day
* Maintaining production systems or handling operational overhead
* Writing reports that collect digital dust


**VP Of AI Research And Development Key Responsibilities**
 Your mission is to become the authoritative voice in AI technical research, delivering concrete implementation guidance that empowers our portfolio companies to leverage AI effectively and maintain their competitive edge in the rapidly evolving AI landscape.
   

  

**Basic Requirements**
* Master of LLM architectures with deep insight into their potential and constraints
* Proven track record in prompt engineering and sophisticated model evaluation
* Polyglot developer comfortable with rapid prototyping across various programming languages
* Expert in creating robust automated testing and benchmarking systems
* Distinguished technical writer with a gift for clear, compelling communication
* Sharp analytical mind capable of identifying patterns and extracting valuable insights
* Confident voice ready to champion well-researched technical positions
* Natural content creator eager to share insights with the wider tech community


**About Trilogy**
 Hundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.
   

  

 There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!
   

  

**Working with Crossover**
 This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $100 USD/hour, which equates to $200,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.
   

  

 Crossover Job Code: LJ-5472-SE-Stockhol-VPofAIResearch1

title: Head of Impact & Startup Founder (March 2025)
job_function: Information Technology, Business Development, and Strategy/Planning
company_industry: Venture Capital and Private Equity Principals
description:
**This ad is not for an employment, but an opportunity to build a VC-backed startup from the ground up.** 




  





**Who you are:** 




 You are a highly accomplished professional with a demonstrated track record in advancing sustainability initiatives. Your expertise lies within critical areas like renewable energy, food security, or the blue economy. Driven by a passion for positive change, you envision building a groundbreaking tech startup that disrupts the status quo and propels sustainability solutions forward.
 



  





**About Antler** 




 Antler is the world's most active venture capital firm, providing funding from pre-seed to Series C. We invest in Founders who seek to define our tomorrow and reshape the world we live in with groundbreaking technological innovation. Every year, we handpick the strongest Founders from more than 135,000 applicants across our 27 locations on the globe, which has led us to work with more than 7,000 founders to date and a portfolio of more than 1,000 startups.
 



  





**The Antler Founder Residency** 




 Join a dynamic cohort of 200+ highly motivated entrepreneurs for an immersive 12-week program. Visit our website for a detailed breakdown of how we'll support your startup launch.
 


* 12-Week full-time Immersive Journey: Kicking off March, 2025, in Stockholm.
* Co-Founder Discovery: In the first 10 weeks, collaborate with fellow Founders to find your co-founder(s).
* Pitch to Invest: Present your team and business idea to the Antler Investment Committee. Secure a net cash investment of EUR 100k for 10% equity.
* Accelerate Growth: If funded, we work closely with you to make your startup a success!



  





**Program Details** 



* **Start Date:** 
 March 3rd, 2025
* **Location:** 
 Onsite at our Stockholm office
* **Compensation:** 
 While participants don't receive financial compensation during the program, pre-seed investment is available to jumpstart your venture.
* **Visa Sponsorship:** 
 Due to the non-employment nature of the program, visa sponsorship is unavailable.



  





**Ideal Candidate Profile** 



* **Domain Expertise:** 
 Possess in-depth knowledge of sustainability sectors like renewable energy, waste management, or the blue economy. You're passionate about building scalable solutions for a greener future.
* **Problem-solving Prowess:** 
 Derive satisfaction from developing innovative products that address real-world challenges.
* **Impact Driven:** 
 Fuel a burning desire to make a positive difference for both people and the planet.
* **Optional:** 
 Arrive equipped with a nascent business idea focused on a specific problem, solution, or technology.



  





**Application Process** 




 Our streamlined application process takes only 2-3 weeks:
 


1. Apply through our website.
2. Participate in an introductory interview.
3. Progress to an in-depth interview with our partners.
4. Receive a potential offer.



  





**Meet Our Nordic Success Stories:** 



* **Wingbits:** 
 Community-driven flight data; redefining air travel efficiency.
* **Two:** 
 A comprehensive B2B payment suite simplifying sales for online and offline businesses.
* **Evyon:** 
 A developer of eco-friendly battery energy storage systems.
* **Glint Solar:** 
 Software accelerating identification of optimal solar installation sites.
* **PerPlant:** 
 AI-powered sensor systems creating a gateway to sustainable agriculture
