job_function: General Business, Management, and Business Development
description:
At Nissan, we're not just building cars, we're revolutionizing mobility. We believe that every individual possesses a unique set of skills and passions that can be harnessed to drive innovation and shape the future of the automotive industry. Our global impact is fueled by a force of over 160,000 dedicated minds, crafting and delivering innovation since 1933. For over 90 years, our core belief in doing what others don't has driven innovation and excitement for our customers, shaping Nissan into the business it is today. We are not just a company - we're a movement, pushing boundaries and embracing the spirit of "Defy Ordinary".
   

  

 We are now looking for an Innovation Explorer & MVP designer to join our newly created RBU. In this role, you will join the Analytics & Innovation team and report to the Analytics & Innovation Director.
   

  

**How you can contribute and have an impact?**
* Identify and explore innovation territories and ensure the desirability aspect of innovation projects.
* Territory Identification: Research and identify new areas for innovation that align with market trends, customer needs, and organizational goals.
* Desirability Assessment: Evaluate the desirability of innovation projects by conducting market research, user testing, and feasibility studies.
* Innovation Exploration: Lead exploratory projects to test and validate new ideas, ensuring they meet desirability criteria.
* Stakeholder Engagement: Collaborate with internal teams, customers, and external partners to gather insights and feedback on potential innovation territories.
* Trend Analysis: Monitor industry trends, emerging technologies, and competitive landscapes to inform innovation strategies.
* Concept Development: Develop and refine innovative concepts, ensuring they are desirable, feasible, and viable.
* Project Management: Oversee the execution of innovation projects from ideation to implementation, ensuring alignment with desirability goals.
* Reporting and Communication: Communicate findings, insights, and recommendations to senior leadership and other stakeholder.


**What we look for:**
* Proven experience in innovation management, ecosystem facilitation, or a related role.
* Bachelor's degree in Business, Innovation Management, Engineering, or a related field. A master's degree is preferred.
* Fluency in English, other local languages are considered as an advantage.
* Strong strategic thinking, project management, and communication skills. Ability to build and maintain relationships with diverse stakeholders.
* Creative, proactive, and adaptable with a passion for driving change and fostering innovation.
* Upskilling, User research, Trend scouting, Collective intelligence, New business model design, Market sizing, Workshop animation.


 Nissan believes the power comes from the inside, the diversity and well-being of its employees is key to success. People are our most valuable assets, and diversity and inclusion are the key to maximizing the power of each individual member of our team. Nissan is committed to be a truly diverse, equitable, and inclusive company that empowers everyone to bring their best, most authentic selves to work. Respecting each person, their opinions and value is when we can drive innovations that make a difference.
   

  

 Our future vision and ambition is "Together We Empower Mobility and Beyond" for a cleaner, safer and more inclusive world.
   

  

 Amsterdam Netherlands

title: E-handelschef
description:
Som E-handels- och Marknadschef hos Live it blir du en nyckelperson i bolagets pågående transformation. Du rapporterar direkt till GM och ingår i ledningsgruppen, där du förväntas aktivt bidra till strategiarbetet framåt, inklusive geografisk expansion, nya produkter och initiativ för kundlojalitet.
 



  





 Rollen innebär fullt strategiskt och budgetansvar för bolagets marknadsfunktion och e-handel. Fokus ligger på att driva både intäktstillväxt och kostnadsoptimering, men kräver även en stark operativ närvaro. Du förväntas vara en "doer" – en som inte bara leder och skapar strategi utan också aktivt implementerar och genomför de dagliga operativa uppgifterna för att säkerställa att både kortsiktiga och långsiktiga mål nås.
 



  





 Som E-handels- och Marknadschef kommer du att utveckla och implementera en övergripande strategi för att stärka bolagets digitala affär. Du ansvarar för att identifiera tillväxtmöjligheter, förbättra kundupplevelsen online samt optimera bolagets digitala erbjudanden. Din förmåga att vara både strategisk och operativ är avgörande för att säkerställa att alla initiativ genomförs effektivt och ger resultat.
 



  





**I dina huvudsakliga ansvarsområden ingår att:** 



* Skapa och genomföra en färdplan för att förbättra kundresan, webbplatsens funktionalitet och digitala tjänster.
* Driva marknadsaktiviteter med fokus på ROI och effektivitet, inklusive SEO/SEM, innehållsmarknadsföring, betalda och sociala medier.
* Optimera produktutbud, kampanjer och användarupplevelser för att öka konvertering och genomsnittligt ordervärde.
* Analysera försäljningsresultat, kundfeedback och webbplatsdata för att identifiera nya tillväxtmöjligheter.
* Vara aktivt operativ i implementeringen av nya initiativ, agera snabbt och effektivt för att leverera resultat.
* Bygga ett starkt och engagerat team genom ledarskap, stöd och aktivt deltagande i både strategiskt och operativt arbete.
* Arbeta nära andra avdelningar för att säkerställa att e-handels- och marknadsstrategier integreras med övriga delar av verksamheten.



  





**Rollen innebär personalansvar för ett team bestående av tre personer. Du ansvarar för att bygga en samarbetsinriktad och resultatdriven kultur, med fokus på kontinuerlig utveckling och mätbara resultat.** 




  





**Om dig** 




  





 Dina erfarenheter och kunskaper:
 



  




* Akademisk utbildning inom ekonomi eller motsvarande.
* Flera års erfarenhet som E-handelschef, gärna från konsumentinriktade bolag.
* Erfarenhet av att både driva intäktstillväxt och kostnadsoptimering.
* Dokumenterad framgång i att driva tillväxt och digital transformation samt att utveckla kundupplevelser digitalt.
* Gedigen kunskap om digitala marknadsföringskanaler (SEO, SEM och sociala medier).
* Avancerad färdighet i analysverktyg (t.ex. Google Analytics och verktyg för marknadsföringsautomatisering) samt förmåga att utvinna användbara insikter.
* Ledarerfarenhet och förmåga att bygga resultatdrivna team.
* Flytande i svenska och engelska.



  





**Du som person:** 




  




* Positiv och driven med en naturlig vilja att prestera och fokus på att nå resultat.
* Kommunikativ teamplayer med vilja och förmåga att leda andra.
* Strategiskt tänkande med ett tydligt affärsfokus.
* Analytisk, datadriven och strukturerad.
* Trivs i en snabbfotad och dynamisk miljö och har förmågan att vara både strategisk och operativ när det behövs.



  





**Frågor om tjänsten?** 




 Mejla elin.cedwall@liveit.se
 








**Har vi väckt ditt intresse?** 




 Välkommen in med din ansökan: jobb@liveit.se
 



 Rektrytering sker löpande så skicka gärna in din ansökan omgående. Märk mailet med ”E-handelschef” då vi har flera spännande tjänster ute.

title: Senior Sales Executive - New Business - PSO
description:
Meet Unit4—a fast-paced, game-changing SaaS company revolutionizing ERP for scale-ups, mid-market organizations, and category leaders. We’re not just rewriting the rules of enterprise software; we’re tearing up the old playbook. For 40 years, the ERP industry has been bogged down by clunky, legacy systems, and we’re here to shake things up.
   

  

 At Unit4, we’re all about transformation. We empower ambitious businesses with cutting-edge ERP solutions that are adaptive, intuitive, and self-driving—designed to free organizations from the mundane and help them focus on what truly matters. Our mission? To turn work into something more meaningful while helping our customers achieve their greatest potential. Want to learn more about how we’re reshaping the future? Head to our website and see how we’re helping businesses thrive.
   

  





  

  

  

  




**Job Description**

 We’ve got an exciting opportunity for a trailblazer to join our high-energy, fast-growing sales team. If you’re a natural hunter, a born deal-closer, and someone who thrives in fast-paced environments, this is your chance to shine.
   

  

 As a New Business Account Manager, you’ll play a critical role in driving digital transformation for scale-ups, mid-market organizations, and category leaders in the Professional Services sector. Your mission: sell Unit4’s ERP Financial and HCM solutions, win new logos, and help our clients unlock their true potential.
   

  

 This is a senior role with massive impact, this is a hybrid role based out of our Stockholm office.
   

  





 What You’ll Do
   

  




* Craft and execute a killer new business sales strategy to hit ambitious targets in the Professional Services vertical.
* Qualify leads like a pro and engage key decision-makers with a consultative, value-driven approach.
* Own complex sales cycles from start to finish, orchestrating cross-functional teams—pre-sales, value engineering, marketing, and more—to close big deals.
* Deliver powerful, results-oriented presentations to C-level execs, focusing on their core challenges and the Office of the CFO.
* Help prospects see the business impact of our solutions, turning skeptics into believers.
* Stay ahead of the curve by mastering our tech and keeping up with industry trends


**Qualifications**
* You’re a go-getter with 8–10+ years of experience selling complex SaaS solutions.
* You have a proven track record in ERP or financial SaaS sales (mandatory).
* You’re a pro at navigating the Professional Services sector and understand its unique needs.
* Business processes? You know them inside and out.
* You have the charisma to inspire, the resilience to negotiate, and the vision to guide clients toward success.
* You’re a team player with a hunter’s mindset, always looking for that next big win.
* You’re comfortable engaging and influencing C-level executives, turning tough challenges into bold opportunities.
* Mentorship, leadership, and collaboration come naturally to you—you’re always ready to lift others while driving results.


**Additional Information**

 Why Unit4?
   

  





  

 At Unit4, we believe in big ideas, bold action, and breaking barriers. Here’s what sets us apart:
   

  





  

  




* Freedom to Thrive: We trust you to own your role and drive success, offering autonomy and flexibility.
* Uncapped Time Off: Take the time you need to recharge—your well-being matters.
* Global Wellbeing Days: When we say “switch off,” we mean it. We all take time to prioritize health and balance.
* Next-Level Talent: Collaborate with some of the sharpest minds in the software industry.
* Purpose-Driven Impact: Be part of our Act4Good program, where innovation meets sustainability to make the world better.
* Inclusive Culture: We’re committed to diversity, equity, and belonging through our Employee Resource Groups like Women at Unit4, Pride at Unit4, and Mental Health & Access at Unit4.



  

 This is your chance to join a company that’s as ambitious as you are. If you’re ready to disrupt the status quo and make a real impact, let’s talk.
   

  

 Ready to take the leap? Apply now and let’s make work better, together.

title: Experienced Atlassian Consultant
description:
**Introduction to Eficode**
 We are building the future of software development - specialising in Cloud, DevOps, Agile, and Development. We help our customers transform into software-driven organisations, aiming to change the world by sharing our knowledge. Our employees value: opportunities for growth, emphasis on mental wellbeing, and a supportive, autonomous team culture.
   

  

 Now, we're hiring for a talented and driven 'Experienced Atlassian Consultant' to join our Sweden team - does this sound like you? Apply today!
   

  

**Role purpose**
 As an Experienced Atlassian Consultant at Eficode, you will help clients optimize their software development and collaboration workflows using Atlassian tools like Jira, Confluence, and Bitbucket. With your deep technical expertise and strategic mindset, you’ll provide tailored solutions and drive the integration of these tools with other enterprise systems, such as ServiceNow and Azure DevOps. You’ll collaborate with clients to understand their needs and implement best practices to maximize efficiency and scalability.
   

  

 In this role, you will work on complex, high-impact projects alongside a team of experienced specialists, continuously learning and sharing knowledge. Your contributions will help organizations transform into agile, software-driven enterprises, while also advancing your career in a dynamic, growth-focused environment at Eficode.
   

  

**Role Responsibilities**
*Your main responsibilities will include (but won’t be limited to):*
* Work closely with customers providing expert guidance on Atlassian product implementations and customizations
* Use your skills to tailor solutions for Jira, Confluence, Bitbucket, and other Atlassian products
* Lead and/or participate in complex implementations of ITSM and DevOps solutions in large and mid-sized organizations
* Design and implement integrations between Atlassian tools and other enterprise systems such as ServiceNow, Azure DevOps, or other enterprise systems
* Collaborate with a team of experienced Atlassian specialists to solve technical challenges and drive best practices for customers
* Be an Atlassian certified expert with the skills to support and implement best-in-class solutions


**Success factors**
*You will make a great match for this role if you have:*
* Extensive experience as a consultant and well established apps related to the Atlassian Platform
* Technical background, with experience in scripting, automation, and/or systems integration or system development in general
* Understanding of ITIL practices or experience from ITSM organisations
* Understanding of Agile practices or ways of working
* Understanding of related tools (for instance GitHub, Azure DevOps, Bitbucket or others) and the enterprise tooling landscape as a whole
* A problem-solving mindset
* A desire to continuously learn and keep up to date with the development of the Atlassian platform


**Desired Skills And Qualifications**
*It would be an added bonus if you have:*
* Experience working in or leading projects and technical implementations
* Understanding of the software development lifecycle
* Atlassian certifications, accreditations or badges


**About You**
*The type of person we're looking for has:*
* A problem-solving mindset
* A desire to continuously learn and keep up to date with the development of the Atlassian platform
* A good team player
* An eagerness to share knowledge with peers and clients


**What’s in it for you?**
* Be part of a leading DevOps and Atlassian consulting company with over 650 experts across 10 countries
* Work with exciting customers across industries and tackle complex system implementation projects
* Grow your career in a learning driven culture with opportunities for training, certifications, and knowledge sharing ✔ With over 90 colleagues in Sweden, we have offices in Stockholm, Gothenburg, Malmö and Sundsvall. Our flexible and open work culture, focus on continuous learning, and industry leading expertise make us a great place to grow your career..


**At Eficode, We Offer**
* A flexible and dynamic work environment with opportunities for remote work.
* A strong learning culture, with access to certifications, training, and conferences.
* A team of driven and experienced colleagues who support and challenge each other.
* A company where your expertise makes a difference – influence solutions and drive innovation.


**Location**
 This role will be based in Stockholm, Sweden and will offer a hybrid working model with a minimum of one day in the office per week.
   

  

**DEI Statement**
 At Eficode we are committed to offering an inclusive recruitment process and equal opportunities for all applicants. We are dedicated to creating a work environment that embraces diversity, inclusion, and respect for all employees. We believe that our differences make us better. We recognise that by having diverse perspectives, skills, ages, genders, backgrounds, and cultures, we will better drive our customers forward and innovate in our field.
   

  

 To ensure a fair recruitment process, please refrain from sharing unnecessary personal information or an image of yourself in your job application.

title: Specialistsäljare inom Digital Workplace
description:
Vill du arbeta med försäljning och vara en del av en ledande aktör inom framtidens digitala arbetsplatser? Vi söker en affärsdriven specialistsäljare som har en passion för att hjälpa kunder att lyckas med sin digitala transformation. Hos Atea blir du en del av ett engagerat team som arbetar för att bygga Sverige med IT. Här får du en dynamisk arbetsmiljö där innovation, samarbete och ansvarstagande står i fokus. Bli en del av oss!
 



  





**Din roll på Atea** 




 Som specialistsäljare inom Digital Workplace kommer du att spela en avgörande roll i att skapa och utveckla affärsrelationer med kunder inom Stockholm och Uppsala län. Du arbetar proaktivt med att identifiera affärsmöjligheter, driva försäljning och leverera kundanpassade lösningar för digitala arbetsplatser. Du kommer att ha en central roll i att förstå och analysera kundernas behov och omsätta dem i affärsmässiga och tekniska lösningar.
 



  





 Dina ansvarsområden i rollen som Specialistsäljare inom Digital Workplace:
 


* Bygga och utveckla långsiktiga relationer med IT-beslutsfattare och inköpare
* Identifiera och driva nya försäljningsmöjligheter inom digitala arbetsplatser och produktnära tjänster
* Samarbeta med kundansvariga säljare, tekniska specialister och strategiska partners för att skapa skräddarsydda erbjudanden
* Hålla dig uppdaterad om marknadstrender och teknologiska innovationer primärt inom PC/Mac, smartphones men även dokumenthantering är meriterande
* Driva digital transformation genom att vägleda kunder i övergången till moderna IT-lösningar, molntjänster och hybridmiljöer
* Genomföra affärsmöten, presentationer och demonstrationer för kunder
* Ansvara för upphandlingar, offertarbete och kontraktsförhandlingar
* Driva hållbarhetsinitiativ genom exempelvis 100%-klubben och Atea Sustainability Focus för att hjälpa kunder att arbeta mer hållbart och effektivt
* Ta en rådgivande roll gentemot kunder och hjälpa dem att optimera sina digitala arbetsplatser utifrån verksamhetsbehov och framtida teknikutveckling



  





**Vad vi söker hos dig** 




 Vi söker dig som har ett starkt affärssinne och en passion för digital utveckling. Du är en kommunikativ relationsbyggare som inger förtroende och som drivs av att skapa värde för kunder. Du har en stark samarbetsförmåga och ett resultatorienterat arbetssätt. Du trivs med att driva ditt arbete självständigt från start till mål.
 



  





 Som Specialistsäljare inom Digital Workplace ser vi att du även har med dig:
 


* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av IT-försäljning med fokus på digitala arbetsplatser och molntjänster
* Förmåga att balansera tekniska och affärsmässiga diskussioner och översätta kundbehov till lönsamma affärsmöjligheter
* Erfarenhet av konsultativ försäljning och att skapa kundanpassade lösningar
* Erfarenhet av digital transformation och att leda kunder genom förändringsprocesser kopplade till IT och molntjänster
* Obehindrad i både svenska och engelska språket i tal och skrift
* B-körkort och möjlighet att resa inom regionen



  





 Meriterande:
 


* Erfarenhet av offentlig upphandling och LOU
* Kunskap inom Life Cycle Management (LCM) och hållbara IT-lösningar
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med strategiska partners och leverantörer inom IT-branschen
* Erfarenhet av lösningsförsäljning och värdeadderande tjänster för modern arbetsplatsinfrastruktur



  





**Om Atea** 




 Visste du att Atea är den ledande leverantören av IT-infrastruktur i Norden och Baltikum? I Sverige har vi 2700 medarbetare på 35 kontor. Vår styrka är vår lokala närvaro, omfattande erbjudande och alla våra specialister. Tillsammans med kunder och partners bygger vi Sverige med IT och förbättrar vardagen för skolbarn, lärare, äldre, sjukvård och näringslivet. Hos oss får du vara en del av världens mest hållbara IT-servicebolag, där vi är med och påskyndar omställningen mot en mer hållbar IT-värld.
 



  





 På Atea blir du en del av en kultur med framåtanda, laganda och humor. Vi strävar efter att vara “The Place to Be” - en plats där alla växer och trivs, med kollegor som bryr sig om dig, kunderna och samhället.
 



  





**Kontakt & mer information** 




 Är detta din nästa utmaning? Vi rekryterar löpande, så skicka in din ansökan redan idag! Har du frågor om tjänsten är du varmt välkommen att kontakta Johnie Karlsson, Försäljningschef, via johnie.karlsson@atea.se.
 



  





 Som en kvalitativ del i vår rekryteringsprocess genomgår slutkandidater även en bakgrundskontroll, detta för att öka kännedomen om dig som vår framtida medarbetare.
 



  





 Atea vill vara The Place To Be, den självklara platsen, för alla människor då vi värdesätter och jobbar aktivt med mångfald och inkludering.
 



  





 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan - tillsammans bygger vi Sverige med IT!
 



**Följ oss i sociala medier**

title: Business Development Manager
description:
G+D makes the lives of billions of people around the world more secure. We shape trust in the digital age with built-in security tech in three segments: Digital Security, Financial Platforms and Currency Technology. We have been a reliable partner for our customers for over 170 years with our innovative solutions for SecurityTech! We are an international technology group and traditional family business with over 14,000 employees in 40 countries. Creating Confidence is our path to success. Trust is the basis of our collaboration within G+D.
   

  

 We are the reliable partner for all challenges resulting from the Internet of Things. We offer a complete connectivity portfolio for mobile network operators, automotive manufacturers, technology companies such as chip and module manufacturers as well as transport and logistics providers. Our portfolio includes highly secure solutions in the area of connectivity & IoT, from classic SIM, eSIM and iSIM, to the associated embedded operating systems and life cycle management, through to services for global connectivity and IoT solutions. Do you want to actively shape the digital transformation with us?
   

  

**Give yourself an outstanding opportunity to develop and form career in a dynamic and international environment.** 
**Join Our Team as a Business Development Manager - Telecoms Industry in Northern Europe (UK, Ireland, Scandinavia, and Baltics)**
 Are you passionate about driving innovation in the Telecoms and IOT industry? Do you thrive in a dynamic environment and are ready to embrace the digital transformation era? We are looking for a talented and ambitious Business Development Manager to join our team and lead the charge in selling cutting-edge telecoms and Internet of Things (IoT) solutions.
   

  

**Abou** 
**t Us:**
 Giesecke+Devrient is a leading player in the Telecoms industry, committed to revolutionising the way communication happens in the digital age. We specialise in providing state-of-the-art digital solutions, connectivity and IoT services that empower businesses to stay ahead in the fast-paced world of telecommunications.
   

  

**Rol** 
**e Overview:**
 As a Business Development Manager, you will be the driving force behind signing up new customers for our digital offerings, connectivity and IoT services, which include SIM, eSIM platform, mobile connectivity, and tracking solutions. Your role will involve identifying and pursuing business opportunities, building strategic partnerships, and ensuring the successful adoption of our innovative solutions in the Telecoms & IoT sectors.
 **Key Responsibilities:**
* Strategic Planning: Develop and implement a comprehensive business development strategy to achieve revenue targets and market expansion.
* Market Analysis: Identify industry sectors and the key targets within them. Attend industry events and generate new leads.
* Client Engagement: Build and nurture relationships with key stakeholders, understanding their business needs and positioning our digital offerings, connectivity and IoT solutions as the ideal solution.
* Solution Presentation: Articulate the value proposition of our digital and IoT offerings through engaging presentations, demonstrating how they address the unique challenges of Telecom and IoT companies.
* Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including product development, marketing, and customer support, to ensure seamless delivery and customer satisfaction.
* Sales Pipeline Management: Effectively manage the sales pipeline, from lead generation to closure, ensuring accurate forecasting and reporting.


**Qualifications:**
* Proven track record in business development, sales, or account management in the Telecoms/IoT industry.
* Strong understanding of digital solutions including SIM, eSIM, mobile connectivity, and IoT technologies.
* Exceptional communication and presentation skills.
* Ability to build and maintain strong relationships with clients and internal teams.
* Strategic thinking and problem-solving abilities.


**What can we offer you?**
 In this role you will have the opportunity to work with talented people in an international and innovative environment. G+D is a well-established family-owned company at the forefront of the market. Besides a dynamic and evolving industry, we offer you:
   

  

* 4500 SEK wellness allowance/year
* 3 additional days off/year
* 1 sport activity hour/week
* Collective Agreement – IT & Telekomföretagen within Almega
* Benify Portal – Health activities and discounts
* Skandia Health Insurance
* Vacation exchange
* Hybrid office 50% from home (if you want to)
* Breakfast at the office every Wednesday


 Get to know us and our people a little better at G+D Sweden by listening to our Jobcast below:
   

  

 Shaping the next chapter of the digital ageSpotify: https://open.spotify.com/episode/71GyhbDv090LgVyukyLf7v?si=f399b1f0d93e47e3Acast: https://shows.acast.com/5cdc00c69e126b7939fb506b/646e072f95211700118d82a4
   

  

 Our DNA is in our peopleSpotify: https://open.spotify.com/episode/6BpWiUCMXr3q68dSGEr2w7?si=e4328a3c8db34b8dAcast: https://shows.acast.com/5cdc00c69e126b7939fb506b/646e070580b8d100110f0e95

title: Supply Chain & Operations Manager Sweden
description:
**Do you want to help solve complex Supply Chain problems to position our clients for sustainable growth while remaining resilient in times of change?**
 We are experiencing heavy growth and are searching for an excellent business-driven
 **Manager** 
 with experience and interest in
 **Supply Chain and Operations** 
 . You will be part of a leading Nordic Supply Chain and Operations team, working on creating customer centric, resilient, and sustainable supply chains for clients across the Nordics. If you want to help solve complex problems, manage key stakeholders, and help design the supply chains of the future, we want to hear from you!
   

  

**What´s in it for you:**
- Competitive salary terms, bonus schemes, pension, health insurance, employee stock purchase program etc.

- Flexible workload – you have control over your everyday life

- Possibility to specialize and build expertise within supply chain topics through our trainings and specialization program

- Work in a team dedicated to complex problem solving within supply chain and operations, working in a range of industries and projects

- Work alongside leading Nordic and global subject matter experts

**What you will do:**
- Address the needs of Supply Chain Officers and help them make strategic and operational Supply Chain decisions through value driven recommendations

- Provide expertise and insights to our clients to help them build the strategic roadmap for their transformation agendas

- Engage in transformation work ranging from operations optimization to technology-driven business transformation

- Design and improve processes and organizations to position the Supply Chain as a growth enabler

- Contribute to develop our Supply Chain and Operations practice’s assets and knowledge repository

- Mentor junior members of the Strategy & Consulting team and coach them for more responsibility and impact

**To succeed in this role, we believe you have:**
- 5–10 years of working experience from Supply Chain Management, preferably as Management Consultant or from operational improvement projects in large organizations

- A passion for Supply Chain Management / Operations, Logistics / Transportation, Sourcing and Procurement, and an understanding of Operating Models and Process improvement

- An ability to identify and pursue new business opportunities by teaming up with relevant colleagues, and lead and contribute to proposal work to build a pipeline of relevant client work for the SC&O practice

- Experience from collaborating with larger, diverse project teams, bringing the Supply Chain & Operations aspect, and can work creatively in a problem-solving environment

- An ability to communicate effectively and can put ideas and findings into the right context and to the right audience, both written and verbally

- A Master’s degree in a relevant field, e.g. Logistics, Engineering or Business

- You can travel when required, depending on client and project context

**The position will report to the Supply Chain & Operations Lead in Sweden. The home office can be either in Gothenburg or Stockholm, Sweden.**
**Interested?**
**Apply as soon as possible** 
 by attaching your
 **CV, cover letter and your educational documents including grades** 
 .
   

  

 If you have any questions concerning the role or the recruiting process, please contact Magnus Wigernäs +46 76 767 2134, Senior Recruiting Specialist Strategy & Consulting Nordics
   

  

**About Supply Chain And Operations**
 Accenture’s Supply Chain & Operations team is a world leading practice with a local presence in the Nordics and Norway. We are a part of Accenture Strategy & Consulting and focuses on key topics for CEOs, COOs, Supply Chain and Procurement Chief Officers.
   

  

 We help our clients imagine and transform tomorrow’s supply chains and operations to positively impact business, society, and the planet. Our work includes optimizing and establishing flexible operations that enable rapid response to changing customer demands and market opportunities. Strategy, technology, analytics and solid execution are at the core of our efforts to future-proof Supply Chains that deliver on the promise of a better and more sustainable world.
   

  

**About Accenture**
**Accenture** 
 is a leading global professional services company, providing a broad range of services and solutions in strategy, consulting, digital, technology and operations. With more than 740,000 people serving clients in more than 120 countries, Accenture drives innovation to improve the way the world works and lives.

title: Konsult inom dataskydd och efterlevnad
job_function: Consulting, Information Technology, and Project Management
company_industry: Business Consulting and Services, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Computer and Network Security
description:
**Vill du jobba med varierande uppdrag jämsides med de allra mest erfarna i IT-branschen?** 




  





 Midagon är en nordisk, oberoende verksamhets- och IT-konsultfirma specialiserad på att genomföra utmanande transformationsprojekt och program. Vi är över 200 anställda i Norden, varav närmare 100 befinner sig i Sverige. Vi driver uppdrag i både privat och offentlig sektor, åt stora globala aktörer såväl som nationella företag. Våra uppdrag varierar i storlek, men gemensamt är att vi hjälper våra kunder att lyckas med sina komplexa transformationer, där vi kan stoltsera med långa kundrelationer samt flertalet egna ramavtal.
 



  





 Våra erfarna konsulter har en bakgrund inom IT-säkerhetsområdet med fokus på bland annat riskhantering, informationssäkerhet men även specialkompetens inom specifika ämnesområden som säkerhetsarkitektur och IT-juridik. Hos oss hittar du de bästa av de bästa. Ett ypperligt kvitto är våra utmärkelser som DI Gasellföretag, Sveriges nöjdaste kunder (Radar), 8 års certifiering av ”Great place to work” samt Superföretag av Veckans affärer.
 



  





 Vill du också vara del av ett team av seniora konsulter, där avslappnad atmosfär går hand i hand med ett engagerat arbete och sund livsbalans?
 



  





**Rollen** 




 I denna roll leder du kundens utmaningar och förändringsprojekt kopplat till informationssäkerhet och IT-juridik i nära samarbete med våra eller kundens säkerhatsteam och verksamhetsutvecklare. Med din expertis fungerar du som en oberoende rådgivare och säkerställer att kunden når sina affärsmål genom säkra och hållbara IT- och verksamhetsprocesser.
 



  





 Internt på Midagon blir du en del av ett team av seniora konsulter med bred erfarenhet inom digital transformation. Teamet har både djup teknisk förståelse och strategisk kompetens gällande regelverk, ramverk och cybersecurity samt erfarenhet från olika branscher och teknologiplattformar, där samarbete och kunskapsutbyte är centrala delar av arbetet.
 



  





**Vi söker dig som** 




 Som person ser vi att du är utåtriktad, energisk och inspirerar din omgivning. Förutom att hantera utmanande och utvecklande uppdrag är du prestigelös och är gärna involverad i att utveckla våra kunder, kollegor och dig själv.
 



  





**Som person ser vi att du har:** 



* Har mångårig konsulterfarenhet
* Erfarenhet av strategiskt och operativt säkerhetskopplade förändringsprojekt
* Hög förmåga av att leda och driva projekt i olika organisationsnivåer med ansvar för krav och strategiarbete inom regelverk och IT-juridik
* Meriterande om du har en juridisk examen
* Kommunicerar obehindrat på både svenska och engelska



  





**Är du nyfiken?** 




 Läs gärna mer om oss och Våra tidigare uppdrag, på hemsidan kan du också enkelt registrerar din ansökan. Har du ytterligare frågor eller funderingar, tveka inte att kontakta Martin Nilsson inom HR-& rekrytering på martin.nilsson@midagon.com / 070-2257833 eller vår Head of people and culture, Hanna Fredriksson på hanna.fredriksson@midagon.com / 076-0074551.
 



  





 Välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Content Designer - Hearts of Iron
description:
*Are you ready to conquer the world together with us? Do you want to be part of a humble and learning-focused team that has the players interest in mind? If you are ready to join us in the march towards the next level of Hearts of Iron, and have a strong experience of strategy games or wargames in general, we want you on our team!*
**Your mission**
 As a Content Designer on the Hearts of Iron team you will be a champion of the player experience, and work with the quality and feel of the game. You will be researching, designing, scripting, and writing engaging content for the game. Your work will have a direct impact on how Hearts of Iron is received and perceived by our fans.
   

  

 You will design and implement gameplay systems and experiences based on 20th century history. Together with the other Content Designers in the team, you will be designing and implementing historical narratives, and writing events in American English that thematically fit within the game. You will be researching related topics and creating believable non-historical storylines that use historical events as an inspiration.
   

  

**The Skills We’re Searching For…**
* An interest in Strategy games and History in general, especially in the Second World War era.
* Top notch writing skills, with an excellent command of American English.
* Experience in narrative design, game design, or experience performing similar tasks in the modding community.
* Experience in code-based scripting.


 You will be working in a team that values collaboration and cooperation. It’s important that you aren’t afraid to raise issues, and that you continuously look for improvement and try to inspire your colleagues. Since we are a fast-paced company, curiosity and an ability to get into things quickly are two important aspects.
   

  

 If you find it motivating to have freedom and the responsibility to take ownership of your task and deliver, but also know when to rely on others for support as well as being a supportive team member, then we’re looking forward to hearing your thoughts on how we can bring Hearts of Iron to the next level.
   

  

**Practical information**
 Scope: Full time and permanent
   

  

 Reports to: Design Manager
   

  

 Location: Stockholm
   

  

*We will not relocate for this position!*
 Today, Paradox consists of both publishing and internal game development. We have a broad portfolio of games and own the most important brands, including Stellaris, Europa Universalis, Hearts of Iron, Crusader Kings, Cities: Skylines, Prison Architect, Victoria, Age of Wonders and the World of Darkness catalog of brands.
   

  

 Since 2004, the company has published its games all over the world, initially through physical distribution but primarily in digital channels after 2006. Paradox games are developed primarily for PC and console platforms, but the company also releases games on mobile. The largest markets today include the US, UK, China, Germany, France and Scandinavia. In total, Paradox games have over five million players each month.

title: Supply Chain Analyst
description:
We are now looking for an agile and analytical
 **Supply Chain** 
**Analyst** 
 to join our Packaging Materials division’s Food Service and Liquid Supply Chain. This role is based in Finland or Sweden and reports to Supply Chain Service Manager.
   

  

**Be part of a nature positive future**
 In this key role, your main responsibilities include
   

  

* breaking down SC cost development to support decision making,
* Operative Working Capital analysis and follow up actions,
* budget and value creation actions follow-up,
* monthly report development for SC performance analysis,
* planning of converting and coating service,
* EDI integration maintenance to key suppliers and
* ensuring correctness of master data.


**About You**
 We are looking for a person with analytical mindset who is outspoken and capable of presenting summarized to-the-point analysis, competent with SQL and willing to learn MS PBI and Papinet. Work experience in Supply Chain and especially in Supply Chain Planning in a multinational environment is a plus. Fluent English is a must and working proficiency in Finnish or Swedish preferred. Bachelor's or master's degree in IT, economy or science is a good background for this position.
   

  

 Ambition – We are looking for a skilled professional with ambition for continuous improvement. You aim to be the best at what you do, share your knowledge and inspire others to develop.
   

  

 Agility – You have a proactive approach and fast decision-making and execution abilities. You are able to make adjustments to plans in an agile manner.
   

  

 Analytical Approach – Data-driven and fact-based approach and follow-up. You base your decisions on facts and use data effectively.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 You will be part of our diverse working culture which supports you in exploring new perspectives and developing professionally. You will contribute to a more sustainable world, as we believe that anything made from fossil-based materials today can be made from a tree tomorrow. Sustainability and innovation are at the core of our strategy. To keep you going safely, we support your physical and mental wellbeing. You get to work with the state of the art IT tools in a truly global company.
   

  

**How can you apply for this role?**
 You can only submit your application via our recruitment tool. We hope to hear from you as soon as possible but at the latest by
 **30 March.**
 For more information, please contact the hiring manager Teemu Syrjänen, teemu.syrjanen@storaenso.com.
   

  

 Our recruitment process can include pre-employment actions such as background, reference and health checks as well as a drug test.
   

  

 We believe diversity strengthens our competitiveness and contributes to better decision-making. Diverse working teams help us to explore different perspectives and challenge our way of thinking. We work actively to increase diversity in the workplace and welcome applicants from diverse backgrounds. Stora Enso is an equal opportunity employer and follows non-discriminatory practices.
   

  

 The Packaging Materials division is a global leader and expert in circular packaging providing premium packaging materials based on virgin and recycled fiber. Stora Enso helps customers replace fossil-based materials with low-carbon, renewable and recyclable alternatives for their food, beverage and transport packaging with a wide selection of base boards and barrier coatings.

title: Senior Compliance officer (AML)
description:
**Company Description**
 Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose – to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.
   

  

 Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.
   

  

**Job Description**
 We are seeking a Senior Compliance Officer who wants to help continue the development of our compliance program and function, primarily in regard to countering financial crime (incl. AML/CTF). As a Senior Compliance Officer with focus on countering financial crime at Tink, you will work closely with colleagues in many different teams (and locations), making it essential that you are business-oriented and able to provide practical and actionable guidance and advice in a user-friendly way.
   

  

 You will join our second line of defense compliance team and closely work with the first line AML/CTF function, risk control, legal, and other Tink staff. As Tink is part of Visa group, you'll access global expertise in countering financial crime. This position is based in Stockholm with a hybrid work setup. The role reports to Tink’s Head of Compliance.
   

  

 What you will do:
   

  

 You will manage and develop Tink's countering financial crime compliance program as part of the second line of defense Compliance function. Although countering financial crime will be your main focus, you will support the Compliance team in managing other regulated areas like payments, consumer protection, business conduct, and governance and ethics. Additionally, you will collaborate with colleagues across the Tink regulated group and Visa group.
   

  

 Your specific responsibilities will include but not be limited to:
   

  

* Take on MLRO responsibilities in accordance with external regulations (delegated from Head of Compliance)
* Ensure that adequate countering financial crime (incl. AML/CTF) policies and procedures are put in place, kept up to date and implemented effectively on an ongoing basis.
* Monitoring and controlling whether the measures, policies and procedures implemented comply with our AML/CTF obligations, and continuously identifying, documenting and proposing measures to manage ML/TF risks.
* As part of the Compliance function, support in the reporting to Tink’s board, management and committees, including supporting the board and management with the development and implementation of the financial crime program, both locally in Europe and globally.
* Annually developing and implementing a risk-based plan for the compliance function's work with AML/CTF.
* Supporting the first line of defense AML/CTF function and the AML/CTF risk owner with support and advice.
* Responsible for ongoing contacts regarding AML/CTF related issues with financial supervisory authorities and FIUs in Sweden and in the other markets where we operate.
* Participating in the development of processes for product development and other strategic projects.
* Developing and holding AML/CTF-related training for the board, management and Tink staff.
* Monitoring new regulations and regulatory trends regarding the AML/CTF regulatory framework and analyzing the impact on Tink and its licensed subsidiaries.


 This is a hybrid position. Expectation of days in office will be confirmed by your hiring manager.
   

  

**Qualifications**
* Previous working experience from a control function in the financial industry (compliance-, risk or internal audit function).
* At least 5 years of experience working with AML/CTF in the financial industry.
* Relevant academic degree from a reputable university or college.
* Experience from a regulated payment institution would be viewed positively.
* The ability to prioritize, structure and adapt to changes in an entrepreneurial environment.
* Strong investigative and analytical skills that you can translate into clear and concise reports, recommendations or decisions.
* Strong communicator in spoken and written English and Swedish.
* High ethical standards and a spotless reputation (background checks will be performed as part of the hiring process).


**Additional Information**
 Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

title: Performance Reporting Section Manager
description:
At Nissan, we're not just building cars, we're revolutionizing mobility. We believe that every individual possesses a unique set of skills and passions that can be harnessed to drive innovation and shape the future of the automotive industry. Our global impact is fueled by dedicated minds, crafting and delivering innovation since 1933. For over 90 years, our core belief in doing what others don't has driven innovation and excitement for our customers, shaping Nissan into the business it is today. We are not just a company - we're a movement, pushing boundaries and embracing the spirit of "Defy Ordinary".
   

  

 We are now looking for a
 **Performance Reporting Section Manager** 
 Nissan's eNEST business division (Netherlands, Belgium, Luxemburg, Norway, Denmark, Sweden).
   

  

**How can you contribute and have an impact?**
* Lead the Performance Coordinators.
* Support dealers, countries, and internal teams with Sales & After Sales performance analysis and tasks.
* Supervise and assist with all Performance reporting files.
* Oversee and support the creation and maintenance of Dealer scorecards.
* Manage Performance Bonuses for Sales & After Sales.
* Utilize the PPM tool.
* Handle landing files.
* Update monthly closure files.
* Follow up on credit limits.
* Report NAE.
* Supervise manual invoice requests (IRF), purchase orders, etc.
* Follow up on dealer incentives.
* Use PRISM.
* Follow up on demo and courtesy cars.
* Utilize Tableau.
* Travel as needed to fulfill job responsibilities.


**What are we looking for:**
* At least 3 years of professional experience.
* Experience in an international, matrix organization is a big plus.
* Background in sales, marketing, reporting, business administration, or assistant roles.
* Bachelor's degree in business or equivalent experience.
* Fluent in English.
* Knowledge of other Nordic languages is a bonus.
* Proficient with Microsoft Office tools and overall good PC skills.
* Strong business planning and analysis abilities.
* Advanced skills in Excel, Access, and databases.
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Comfortable working in a KPI-driven environment.
* Ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines.
* Strong communication and team leadership skills.


 Nissan believes the power comes from the inside, the diversity and well-being of its employees is key to success. People are our most valuable assets, and diversity and inclusion are the key to maximizing the power of each individual member of our team. Nissan is committed to be a truly diverse, equitable, and inclusive company that empowers everyone to bring their best, most authentic selves to work. Respecting each person, their opinions and value is when we can drive innovations that make a difference.
   

  

 Our future vision and ambition is "Together We Empower Mobility and Beyond" for a cleaner, safer and more inclusive world.
   

  

 Strombeek-Bever Flemish Brabant Belgium

title: Delivery Lead - Tietoevry Care (m/f/d)
description:
**You may apply to Tietoevry by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.**
**Tietoevry Care Delivery Lead – key role and person to deliver and develop our customer partnership, and our strategic agenda in Sweden**
**Health and Care market driven by a global digital transformation** 
  

  

 The Health & Care sector is undergoing a profound digital transformation that includes investments across the entire care system to unleash the potential of data driven decisions, connecting all stakeholders, from citizens and patients to specialist care providers.
   

  

 There is an immense need for enhanced digital capabilities in the Health & Care sector – and software businesses like Tietoevry Care have an enormous opportunity to contribute to improved health and care, while at the same time, nurturing substantial business growth.
   

  

**Tietoevry Care – Nordic market leading health & care software company** 
  

  

 We are a market leading clinical software provider in the Nordics. Our software products range from laboratory systems, electronic medical records, clinical specialty systems to welfare systems for elderly and family care, as well as data and analytics. With our +1600 experienced colleagues, Tietoevry Care has a very strong and unique market position and capabilities across the Nordics.
   

  

 Tietoevry Care partners with our customers to modernizing the Nordic health and social care sector with our modular, open, and interoperable software. We are striving at simplifying everyday life for patients and personnel, and providing the tools required to transition towards increased self-and preventive care and lower cost-of-care settings, while placing citizens and patients at the center of our software solutions.
   

  

**Tietoevry Care Data Driven Care – business/product organization** 
  

  

 Data Driven Care is a newly founded growth driving business unit of Tietoevry Care, focusing on software products that connect care and turn care data into actionable insights. Our data and AI-driven solutions address these critical business challenges by offering the tools needed to unlock deeper insights from growing data volumes. With years of experience driving AI innovation in health and social care, we understand the vital role technology plays in transforming service delivery. The Data Driven Care portfolio includes Lifecare Data Platform, Lifecare Open Platform and Lifecare Resource Optimization.
   

  

**About The Role As Delivery Lead**
 You will have a key role in the Data Driven Care business, with the overall responsibility of all implementation projects in Sweden ensuring customer satisfaction, contract fulfilment while achieving financial targets.
   

  

 Among your focus responsibilities and activities are, to
   

  

* Ensuring customer satisfaction, contract fulfilment and achieve financial targets for all implementation project within the Data Driven Care product portfolio in Sweden
* Develop Evolve, our implementation project capabilities in Sweden to continuously improve its performance in terms of e.g. customer satisfaction, contract fulfilment and financial performance
* Expand our implementation and delivery capabilities and team in the Swedish market in line with our business growth
* For key projects, act as the project manager and, for project with dedicated project manager, act as project owner to ensure agreed results in the implementation project
* Leadership, coaching and development of all Project Managers of Data Driven Care implementation projects in Sweden
* Utilize global and local capacity, partner eco-systems and subcontractors to optimize profitability and ensure top quality of the delivery.
* Ensure the right guidance for the customer and be seen as a trusted advisor and partner
* Understand and identify customers’ present and future needs and feedback to sales and product management
* Identification of organic growth opportunities within portfolio, and work with Customer Client Directors to progress and execute such opportunities


**Ideally you possess the following competences and abilities:** 
  

  

* Experience from leading large and complex value driven sales and deliveries in software, IT systems and projects
* Strong experience and knowledge about best-in-class implementation methodology from leading consulting firm or corresponding experience
* Clearly takes the role as strategic advisor and peer to c-level, and below
* Strong presenter and creator of complex value propositions orally and in written
* Proficient oral and written communication skills and effective stakeholder management skills
* Fluent in spoken and written Swedish, and you speak proficient business English


**It would be great if you also had experience from one or more of below areas:** 
  

  

* Business development or strategic IT position at large healthcare provider or at municipality within the Social Care area
* Delivery experience from supplier of complex digital solutions and software to Health and/or Social Care
* Senior management consulting experience for healthcare market
* …..or, the above within relevant firms and to relevant customers providing a good base for our business


**What's in it for you?** 
  

  

 In Tietoevry Care Data Driven Care, you will have extensive opportunities for personal growth and building leading and relevant experience, based on our ambitious growth and expansion targets for the coming years, and that you will enter a company at the heart of one off the globally most interesting markets. Adding to this you will also personally be involved in the development of a sector of the uttermost importance for your fellow citizens and friends.
   

  

 In our team we are working closely with and helping each other, and striving to have a creative, open and fun work together – while striving to deliver strong value for our customers and results for our company.
   

  

**Could you be our new colleague?** 
  

  

 We look forward to hearing from you! We will fill the position as soon as we find the right person, so we encourage you to apply today. If you have any questions regarding this role, please contact the hiring manager and Head of Operational Suite
   

  

 Magnus Åslund: magnus.aslund@tietoevry.com
   

  

*We perform background checks on all final candidates.*
*Tietoevry declines calls from recruitment companies.*
**About Tietoevry**
 Tietoevry creates purposeful technology that reinvents the world for good. We are a leading technology company with a strong Nordic heritage and global capabilities. Based on our core values of openness, trust and diversity, we work with our customers to develop digital futures where businesses, societies, and humanity thrive.
   

  

 Our 24,000 experts globally specialize in cloud, data, and software, serving thousands of enterprise and public-sector customers in more than 90 countries. Tietoevry’s annual turnover is approximately EUR 3 billion and the company’s shares are listed on the NASDAQ exchange in Helsinki and Stockholm, as well as on Oslo Børs.
   

  

 At Tietoevry, we believe in the power of diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, genders (m/f/d), and walks of life to join our team, as we believe that this fosters an inspiring workplace and fuels innovation. Our commitment to openness, trust, and diversity is at the heart of our mission to create digital futures that benefit businesses, societies, and humanity. Diversity, equity and inclusion (tietoevry.com)

title: Pricing Manager
description:
Would you like to be at the forefront of the energy transition?
   

  

 We are now searching for an experienced and motivated
 **Pricing Manager** 
 to take on a crucial role in developing new pricing strategies and models for innovative products in the fast-evolving energy market. This is a unique opportunity to make an impact.
   

  

 Our
 **Portfolio Management & Pricing team** 
 is responsible for managing Fortum’s hedging portfolio and pricing Corporate Customers and Markets’ (CCM) offerings, such as PPA’s, for both our external and internal customers.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Pricing Manager, you will be responsible for developing and implementing pricing strategies and models that align with Fortum’s risk appetite and business performance.
   

  

 Your key responsibilities will include:
   

  

  

* Monitoring, adjusting, and developing pricing strategies and models for our current and future offerings, based on market dynamics and customer.
* Analyzing and pricing different risk exposures (market, credit, liquidity, etc.) and solving complex challenges related to pricing, leveraging your analytical and quantitative skills.
* Collaborating closely with our team’s Portfolio Managers, Sales Managers, and other internal stakeholders to provide expertise in pricing-related matters. You may also participate in meetings and negotiations with large industrial customers.
* Ensuring that the pricing strategies and models become operational and scalable by supporting their deployment to our pricing tools and platforms, together with the team’s Quantitative Developers and Analysts.
* Documenting and validating the developed models under your responsibility according to our governance models.


 The position is permanent and located either in Espoo, Finland or in Solna, Sweden.
   

  

**About You**
 You bring a strong combination of analytical expertise, technical skills and market knowledge to our team. We are looking for an individual with the following:
   

  

  

* Applicable academic degree, that supports your technical and analytical expertise
* At least 5 years of working experience in a related role such as pricing, risk management (e.g. market/credit/cash liquidity), finance, portfolio management and/or quantitative analysis/modelling
* A strong analytical and mathematical background, supporting you in making well-reasoned assessments and approach unforeseen challenges proactively
* Business mindset and preferably a solid understanding of the energy markets
* Proficiency in Python and SQL are an asset
* Ability to adapt to changing situations
* Fluent in English, both written and oral


 You are also a positive, open and honest individual, with the ability of working both independently and as part of a team. You have interest in developing yourself and supporting your colleagues in their development.
   

  

**We offer you**
* A job with a purpose: to power a world where people, businesses and nature thrive together
* Interesting and diverse tasks having a strong impact to the whole company’s future
* Possibilities to grow professionally and to learn new skills
* Strong support by the whole team
* A chance to work with great colleagues and to widen your professional network
* Flexible ways of working; both remotely and at the office


 At Fortum, we believe in a better future and want to be involved in shaping it. Our workplace is a safe place, both physically and mentally. You will grow with professional colleagues, being trusted and free to challenge yourself. We offer comprehensive benefits, flexible working hours, and hybrid work model to support your productivity, development and wellbeing. We are committed to build diverse teams where everyone feels included and is treated equally.
   

  

 More information about our culture and benefits can be found here.
   

  

**Interested?**
 Please submit your application in English via our recruitment tool by
 **30.03** 
 .
 **2025** 
 at the latest.
   

  

 We will begin screening during the application period already and will hire as soon as the right individual is found.
   

  

 If you would like to hear more about the position, please contact hiring manager, Mikko Kerola via email (mikko.kerola@fortum.com) or phone (+358 40 711 4662) during the following hours:
   

  

 Tuesday 11.3. 9-12 EET
   

  

 Friday 14.3. 13-16 EET
   

  

 Wednesday 19.3. 9-12 EET
   

  

 Thursday 20.3. 14-17 EET
   

  

 To be selected for the position, the applicant must go through background clearance and a health examination including drug testing.
   

  

**We are Fortum**
 Fortum is a Nordic energy company. Our purpose is to power a world where people, businesses and nature thrive together. We are one of the cleanest energy producers in Europe and our actions are guided by our ambitious environmental targets. We generate and deliver clean energy reliably and help industries to decarbonise their processes and grow. Our core operations in the Nordics comprise of efficient, CO2-free power generation as well as reliable supply of electricity and district heat to private and business customers. For our :5 000 employees, we commit to be a safe, and inspiring workplace. Fortum's share is listed on Nasdaq Helsinki. fortum.com

title: Sourcing & Procurement Consultant or Manager
description:
Do you have a passion for transforming Sourcing and Procurement to be future-ready – and make it an irreplaceable driver of 360º value for the business? If yes, you have come to the right place. Our team within Supply Chain & Operations Practice focus on key topics for CEOs, COOs, Supply Chain and Procurement Chief Officers – to create new competitive agility through profitability, growth, sustainability, resilience and trust.
   

  

**Accenture’s Supply Chain & Operations team** 
 is a world leading practice with a local presence in the Nordics (Sweden, Norway, Denmark, and Finland) and utilizing truly global capabilities. We are a team that is
 **passionate about solving complex problems in Supply Chains** 
 to position our clients for sustainable growth, while remaining resilient in times of change. We
 **deliver value by aligning Supply Chain’s strategy, operating model and underlying processes to support business strategies** 
 . Strategy, technology, analytics and solid execution are at the core of our efforts in configuring future-proof Supply Chain and Sourcing & Procurement functions that deliver on the promise of a better and more sustainable world.
   

  

 We are now looking for a
 **Sourcing & Procurement Consultant or Manager** 
 to make a difference in
 **project deliveries and business development** 
 in
 **Denmark and in the Nordics** 
 .
   

  

**Responsibilities:**
- Play an important role in Nordic Sourcing & Procurement Community - focusing on enabling change in procurement strategy, operating model design, generative AI, sustainability, Source-to-Pay (S2P) transformations to name a few of the areas

- Together with the team you will identify and pursue new business opportunities and build a pipeline of relevant client work across industries

- Lead and contribute to variety of project deliveries

- Work alongside our clients in their organizations and drive sourcing & procurement to the future

- Contribute towards the growth of our team & the development of our people

**About you:**
- 4 -10 years of relevant sourcing and procurement experience

- Preferably experience in strategy and/or technology consulting but not mandatory

- Ability to identify business opportunities, shape deals, prepare proposals together with clients and expert teams

- Excellent inter-personal skills and the ability to influence, collaborate, partner, motivate and build relationships

- Excellent communication (written and oral) skills in English and Finnish

- M.Sc. degree or equivalent

**What we offer you:**
 We have fun at work and we focus on good work-life balance. We work across Nordics and we support and root for one another. We are psychologically safe environment and everyone´s allowed to be their true selves. Also,
   

  

  

- Truly competitive salary terms, bonus program, health insurance and culture & sports benefits

- Good arrangements to combine family life (and leisure time in general) with work life.

- Extensive wellbeing program that boosts your overall wellbeing, energy and ability to work in a sustainable way

- Opportunities to get involved in corporate citizenship initiatives, from volunteering to doing charity work, as well as Inclusion & Diversity networks

- Talent Lead / Personal Mentor to guide your career within Accenture´s (global) possibilities

- Market-leading expertise and great learning & growth opportunities within technology consulting

**The workplace can be in Copenhagen, Stockholm or Oslo!**
**Does this appeal to you?**
 If so, we really wish to hear from you! Please apply via our system and remember to enclose your CV and cover letter.
 **There is no better place and time to be in Sourcing & Procurement than right here and right now!** 
 If you have any questions concerning the role or the recruiting process, please contact Magnus Wigernäs +46 76 767 2134, Senior Recruiting Specialist, Strategy & Consulting.
   

  

*If you are interested to learn more about Accenture´s recruitment process, great! We have gathered more info for you* 
*here*

title: Relationship Manager
description:
Mentimeter is an engagement tool with a clear goal in mind. To turn presentations into conversations. Through real-time interactivity and clear visualizations, we get people to participate, engage and become more productive. Transforming all those passive meetings, airless classrooms and drawn out trainings into valuable and memorable moments.
   

  

 We truly believe that you achieve the best results by doing things together. And that successful leaders need to adopt a curious and collaborative mindset in order to get there. So with you at Mentimeter, you’ll be a big part of the ambition to help over 1 billion people listen, learn and work better together.
   

  

 As an Relationship Manager, you will lead the expansion of our existing Enterprise customers by focusing on revenue growth while serving as a trusted adviser to our customers.
   

  

 We expect you to have high energy, an entrepreneurial tempo with the main focus on commercial initiatives to drive revenue growth among our Enterprise customers. We are looking for someone who can create long-term and strategic relationships with customers from all over the world.
   

  

**Responsibilities For The Role**
* Full commercial ownership of our current enterprise customers
* Build long-term, strategic relationships with customers all over the world
* Drive revenue growth by building a strong pipeline, while serving as a trusted adviser to our customers
* Manage a continuous pipeline for new expansion and up-sell opportunities
* Ownership of renewals of ongoing agreements in order to prevent churn
* Ability to assess business opportunities and use data in order to support decision-making towards customers
* Develop a strategy for best-in-class scalable customer expansion
* Collaborate together with Customer Success Managers on strategic enterprise customers


**Resources We Have To Support You**
* World-class lead-generation from the Marketing and Product teams
* Marketing and Sales team to support in analysis and tactics
* Sales Development Representatives to support in lead qualification
* Sales Operation function
* Professional CRM and data gathering services (Intercom, Mixpanel, Google Analytics, Salesforce)


**Must-haves For The Role**
* Previous SaaS sales experience
* Ability to assess business opportunities and use data to make informed decisions and persuade others
* Passion for building long-term relationships as well as driving commercial initiatives with customers
* Knowledge of software contract terms and conditions with the ability to create fair transactions
* Strong negotiation, pipeline and forecasting skills
* Ability to manage a large number of customers simultaneously while positioning company products against direct and indirect competitors
* You are required to have professional-level English (we sell to 150+ countries today)
* Excellent communication skills


**Good To Have**
* Additional languages (other than Swedish and English)
* Bachelor or masters degree (field not important)


**Not Required**
* You don’t have to know Swedish (we are an English-first organization, daily work is carried out in English and the Mentimeter team currently boasts over 20 different nationalities!)


 Please note that this position is located onsite at our Stockholm HQ, with the starting date being flexible yet ideally as soon as possible.
   

  

**The Recruitment Process Consists Of**
* Personality test and logical ability test
* Introduction Interview
* Business Case
* Competence Interview
* Culture Interview


**Compensation Model**
 We strongly believe in the power of togetherness, and we put a lot of effort into collaboration, teamwork and helping each other whenever needed. We believe that every part of Mentimeter, from Sales Development Representatives and Account Executives to Frontend Developers and Marketing Managers contributes equally to our continued success. To foster and emphasize this culture and way of working, we apply a non-commission based salary model in our sales roles, which has proven to be very successful and appreciated across the team. You can read about our benefits and perks here.
   

  

**What Mentimeter Can Offer**
 At Mentimeter we can offer a diverse and inclusive work environment supported by smart and driven colleagues. We believe in continuous professional development for all of our colleagues and therefore offer access to a leadership program (including external personal coach) and relevant education to ensure that we continue to be state-of-the-art when it comes to innovating and building Mentimeter. Your place will be in a growing company with lots of career opportunities, working on a beloved product used by more than 300 million people. It’s not all about work though, we also offer a very healthy view on work-life balance.
   

  

 All of this comes attached with a competitive compensation and benefits package, including pension contributions. Learn more about our benefits by visiting our Benefits & Perks page
   

  

**Culture at Mentimeter**
 At Mentimeter we believe in giving everyone a voice - regardless of who you are. So we build a platform that does just that. Our platform is not only our product but also our organization. A platform where people feel safe, where differences are embraced, a place where you can have fun. We strongly encourage applicants who are people of color, LGBTQ+, women, people with disabilities, and/or formerly incarcerated people, and a college degree is not strictly required. In order to give everyone a voice, we need to be as diverse as our users.
   

  

 Learn more about our culture by visiting our Culture page.
   

  

 Review our Privacy Policy for more information.

title: Clinical Quality Assurance Manager - Investigational Medicinal Product (IMP)
description:
**Company Description**
***Statistics show that women and underrepresented groups tend to apply to jobs only if they meet 100% of the qualifications. Sobi encourages you to change that statistic and apply. Rarely do candidates meet 100% of the qualifications. We look forward to your application!***
 At Sobi, the work we do every day redefines the standards of care and transform the lives of people living with rare diseases.
   

  

 As a diverse team of entrepreneurial people, we are passionate about our growth journey towards becoming a global leader, making a difference for rare disease patients, moving quickly and always challenging the status quo.
   

  

 We are committed to an inclusive, sustainable and flexible workplace that fosters growth and development.
   

  

**Job Description**
**About the role**
 As the
 **Clinical Quality Manager** 
 , you will play a pivotal role in ensuring the quality and compliance of Investigational Medicinal Products (IMPs) through your leadership and guidance of supplier management teams. Acting as the single point of contact for external suppliers, you will oversee manufacturing quality, ensure adherence to GMP & GDP regulations, and build strong cross-functional relationships with internal stakeholders.
   

  

 The role is located at the global Sobi HQ in Stockholm, Sweden or in Basel, Switzerland.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Act as the primary quality liaison for external suppliers, organizing inquiries, investigations, and audit follow-ups.
* Maintain oversight of quality topics for Sobi IMPs across markets
* Continuously improve work processes related to quality and compliance of IMPs
* Oversee batch record reviews and release for IMPs across US, EU, and RoW clinical trials.
* Monitor and manage key performance indicators (KPIs) related to IMP supplier quality.
* Ensure compliance with Quality Agreements and support revisions in collaboration with internal teams.
* Work cross-functionally with R&D, GCP/GVP QA, QA Supplier Managers and Product Quality Leads to address and escalate IMP quality issues.
* Support supplier audits and ensure readiness for Health Authority GMP inspections.


**Qualifications**
**About you**
 You are comfortable in a global and dynamic environment where priorities shift often and a highly diplomatic and tactful individual with excellent critical reasoning, risk-analysis, and problem-solving skills. Is it vital to have interpersonal and leadership skills with the ability to influence external suppliers and cross-functional teams to foster open and collaborative discussions around difficult decisions and impactful solutions.
   

  

**Key Qualifications**
* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent education/degree in life sciences.
* Have a solid understanding of the GMP & GDP and GCP requirements in support of IMP study.
* Minimum (10) years of experience within pharmaceutical, biotech product.
* Relevant experience from working with quality aspects of medicinal products in clinical trials, especially batch allocation and supply to clinical trials
* Extensive experience in QA operation, production or other relevant area (GMP, GDP)
* Strong working knowledge of US and European regulations, with emphasis on Annex 13, and preferably other regions such as APAC and LATAM.
* Strong understanding of risk assessment and risk management fundamentals / tools
* Fluently spoken and written English


 Here at Sobi we live by our core values: Care, Ambition, Urgency, Ownership and Partnership!
   

  

**Additional Information**
**How to apply**
 We have an ongoing selection process in this recruitment and ask you to send your application as soon as possible. Click apply and include your resume in English.
   

  

**Why Join Us?**
 Here At Sobi, Our Mission And Culture Get Us Excited To Come To Work Every Day, But Here Are a Few More Reasons To Join Our Team
   

  

* Emphasis on work/life balance
* Collaborative and team-oriented environment
* Opportunities for professional growth
* Diversity and Inclusion
* Competitive compensation for your work
* Making a positive impact to help ultra-rare disease patients who are in need of life saving treatments


 Sobi is a global company with over 1,800 employees in more than 30 countries and are committed to the societies where we operate. We are a specialised international biopharmaceutical company transforming the lives of people with rare and debilitating diseases, providing reliable access to innovative medicines in the areas of haematology, immunology, and specialty care. Sobi’s share is listed on Nasdaq Stockholm. More about Sobi at sobi.com and LinkedIn.
   

  

 We know our employees are our most valuable asset and our culture conveys that. We offer a competitive benefits package, to support the health and happiness of our staff.
   

  

**Sobi Culture**
 At Sobi, we refuse to accept the status quo. This is because we have witnessed first-hand the challenges facing those affected by rare diseases and have used this knowledge to shape our business to find new ways of helping them.
   

  

 As a specialized biopharmaceutical company, we are dedicated to rare diseases. And we see this focus as a strength. By effectively turning our research into ground-breaking treatments, we help make medicine more accessible and open more possibilities for patients and more opportunities for those caring for them. This has been our approach since day one, but we know we can’t change the world of rare diseases on our own. Accomplishing this requires strong partnerships with patients, partners and stakeholders across the entire value chain. Together, we define how our business can create solutions that serve the needs of those affected by rare diseases while facilitating sustainable growth.

title: Restaurangchef
description:
**Är du sugen på nya utmaningar, en karriär inom restaurangbranschen eller ett företag där det går snabbt att växa?** 
**Då har du kommit rätt!**
**Vilka är Brödernas?**
 Brödernas bedriver med framgång sin verksamhet i hela Sverige från Umeå i norr och till Malmö i söder. Brödernas expanderar i en rasande takt med visionen att bli känt även utanför Sveriges gränsen. Vår ambition är att Brödernas ska associeras med god kvalité och fantastisk service. Vi har idag över 90 öppnade enheter i Sverige och vi öppnar nya enheter varje månad.
   

  

 Det viktiga för oss är att oavsett vilket mål du har för framtiden så har vi garanterat en plats för dig. Hos oss är det dina egna ambitioner och resultat som avgör hur långt du kan gå.
   

  

**Vad innebär jobbet som Restaurangchef hos oss?**
 I tjänsten ingår huvudansvar för driften och personalen på restaurangen, vanligtvis ca 15 anställda.
   

  

 Du jobbar med att utveckla dina medarbetare, ger dem vägledning så att dem kan växa genom delegering av arbetsuppgifter. Du har även huvudansvaret för lönsamheten och resultatet för enheten.
   

  

**Bland annat ingår följande ansvar i tjänsten:**
* Service
* Inköp
* Leveranser
* Attestera fakturor
* Schemaläggning
* Prognos och personalkostnad
* Lokal marknadsföring och rekrytering


**Vem är du?**
