title: Senior Statistical Programmer - FSP - ( Permenant,homebased/remote) Evergreen
description:
**Senior Statistical Programmer**
**Global Biostatistics**
**Home-based, office-based, hybrid options available**
**Join us on our exciting journey!**
 The Global Biostatistics (Data Sciences, Safety & Medical) team at IQVIA are experienced in submissions for all major regions; working together with key groups such as, Global Regulatory Affairs, Safety, Project and Data Management, and Medical Writing, to drive efficiency and accountability.
   

  

 IQVIA Biostatistics helps interpret and draw inferences from data collected on patients as they progress through a clinical trial and serves as the bridge between data capture and reporting.
   

  

 We have one of the largest Biostatistics departments within the industry of around 1,100+ staff, to which we engage the full range of industry-leading resources and expertise spanning all study phases and therapeutic areas.
   

  

**Job Overview:**
 As a Senior Statistical Programmer, you will be given access to cutting-edge, in-house technology and opportunities to work on global projects across a variety of therapeutic areas.
   

  

 Thanks to our development opportunities and mentoring at all levels, you will be able to progress your long-term career in the direction you choose.
   

  

 You will provide experienced technical expertise to develop process methodology for the department to meet internal and external clients’ needs.
   

  

 You will plan and coordinate the development of integrated programming solutions, serving the full spectrum of statistical programming needs, along with providing technical expertise and leadership to the department and provide internal consulting services, including specifications and user needs analysis for complex project or client requirements.
   

  

 Acting as a lead on studies, you will directly communicate with internal and client statisticians and clinical team members to ensure appropriate understanding of requirements and project timelines and support the training of new or junior team members. As well as, estimating programming scope of work, manage resource assignments, communicate project status and negotiate/re-negotiate project timelines for deliverables.
   

  

**Requirements:**
* Bachelors or Masters’ in Computer Science, Mathematics or equivalent
* 5+ years Statistical Programming experience within the Life-Science industry
* Experience in SAS® Base, and good knowledge of SAS® graph and SAS® Macros
* Excellent knowledge of CDISC standards (SDTM and ADaM)
* Excellent application development skills
* Strong understanding of clinical trial data and extremely hands on in data manipulations, analysis and reporting of analysis results.
* Experience as technical team lead, directly engaging clients and coordinating tasks within a programming team
* In-depth knowledge of applicable clinical research regulatory requirements, i.e. Good Clinical Practice
* (GCP) and International Conference on Harmonization (ICH) guidelines


**Join IQVIA to see where your skills can take you**
* Global exposure
* Variety of therapeutic areas
* Collaborative and supportive team environment
* Access to cutting-edge and innovative, in-house technology
* Excellent career development and progression opportunities
* Work-Life Balance, with a strong focus on a positive well-being


**Unleash your potential!**
 It takes passion to make the extraordinary possible for patients. Our culture of innovation and collaboration enables us to explore new possibilities and help improve health around the world.
   

  

 When you join our diverse, global team, you’ll harness the power of unparalleled data, advanced analytics, cutting-edge technologies, and deep healthcare and scientific expertise to drive healthcare forward.
   

  

 IQVIA is a leading global provider of clinical research services, commercial insights and healthcare intelligence to the life sciences and healthcare industries. We create intelligent connections to accelerate the development and commercialization of innovative medical treatments to help improve patient outcomes and population health worldwide. Learn more at https://jobs.iqvia.com

title: NetSuite Industry Specialist, EMEA
description:
**Job Description**
 This will be an opportunity to get engaged in sales cycle strategy, customer presentations, marketing initiative and go-to-market (GTM) as well as participating in industry/product meetings, seminars, and round tables to remain up to date on industry and product knowledge. You will be expected to perform an Industry call quarterly to the sales and solution consulting org, updating them with latest trends and analysis for your specific industry.
   

  

 Our team culture is centred around embracing growth mindset, inspiring excellence, and encouraging teams and leaders to bring their best each day. In doing so, we drive innovation and redefine how NetSuite engages with key market segments.
   

  

**Responsibilities:**
* Partner with Sales and Solution Consulting to build and deliver industry presentations during sales engagements. Participation may include customer facing presentations and meetings or behind the scenes strategic planning and education.
* Develop and maintain go-to-market documentation for the Software Industry (e.g., Playbooks, Overview, Personas, Terminology etc.).
* Create demo recordings and videos (internal and external) for the Software Industry.
* Work with marketing on industry specific content and campaigns.
* Deliver industry strategy presentations for key customer events (tradeshows, Conferences webinars, etc.).
* Collaborate with Sales, Solution Consulting, and SDR Enablement teams on Software Industry specific content.
* Provide quarterly industry updates to Sales and Solution Consulting.
* Collaborate with third-party partners to help shape industry strategy (playbooks).
* Attend CAB & Go-to-Market advisory meetings to collaborate with SuiteSuccess, Product Management, and Demo Excellence to ensure consistent messaging for the Software Industry.
* Provide input to Sales on key themes from New Releases as they relate to the Software Industry.
* Identify product gaps and help to solve said gaps with Solution Consultants, partners or collaborate with the product team for future development.
* Mentor/coach team members across the organisation.
* Research industry related topics, trends, and provide analysis and recommendations.
* Manage regular meetings with Sales Leadership to build a strategy for the Software Industry.


**Qualifications**
* A minimum of 5 or more years of overall experience in relevant industry and/or marketing/selling to the relevant industry.
* A minimum of 5 or more years of Oracle NetSuite experience.
* Management experience preferred but not required.
* Self-motivated individual.
* Strong problem-solving skills.
* Strong knowledge of market solutions for relevant industry and cloud trends.
* Strong presentation & product demonstration skills.
* Proven ability to bring teams together and collaborate across organisations.
* Demonstrated ability to establish a winning go to market (GTM) industry strategy.
* Proven ability to establish Trusted Advisor relationships with C-Level Executives (executive presence).
* Excellent communicator / accomplished public speaker.


 Career Level - IC4
   

  

**Responsibilities**
**Detailed Description and Job Requirements**
 Oracle NetSuite is on the hunt for an Industry Specialist to spearhead their Software Industry vertical sales efforts. This role is designed to empower the sales and solution consulting teams with industry-specific knowledge and strategies. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in the Software Industry, coupled with a strong understanding of Oracle NetSuite's capabilities.
   

  

 The Industry Specialist will collaborate across various teams to develop compelling industry presentations, assets, and go-to-market strategies. They will be responsible for creating and delivering customer-centric content, including demos and industry-specific campaigns. This role involves staying up to date with industry trends, providing insights to the sales team, and contributing to product development by identifying gaps.
   

  

 With a focus on mentorship and knowledge sharing, the Industry Specialist will coach team members and maintain strong relationships with third-party partners. Excellent communication skills, a collaborative mindset, and a proven ability to develop winning industry strategies are key to success in this role. Join Oracle NetSuite to make a significant impact on their Software Industry sales performance and market presence. Travel required when needed.
   

  

**Why work at Oracle**
* Join a global workplace where you can make an impact.
* We offer competitive salaries and exciting benefits – along with flexible and remote working to suit your lifestyle.
* Get access to development opportunities that can advance your career, an Employee Assistance Program to support your mental health, and core benefits such as medical, life insurance, and access to retirement planning.
* Be yourself in an inclusive culture where employee resource groups champion our diverse communities.


**What We’ll Offer You**
* A competitive salary with exciting benefits
* Flexible and remote working so you can do your best work
* Learning and development opportunities to advance your career
* An Employee Assistance Program to support your mental health
* Employee resource groups that champion our diverse communities
* Core benefits such as medical, life insurance, and access to retirement planning
* An inclusive culture that celebrates what makes you unique


**Life at Oracle and Equal Opportunity**
 An Oracle career can span industries, roles, Countries and cultures, giving you the opportunity to flourish in new roles and innovate, while blending work life in. Oracle has thrived through 40+ years of change by innovating and operating with integrity while delivering for the top companies in almost every industry.
   

  

 In order to nurture the talent that makes this happen, we are committed to an inclusive culture that celebrates and values diverse insights and perspectives, a workforce that inspires thought leadership and innovation.
   

  

 At Oracle, we believe that innovation starts with diversity and inclusion and to create the future we need talent from various backgrounds, perspectives, and abilities. We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to successfully participate in the job application, interview process, and in potential roles to perform crucial job functions.
   

  

 That’s why we’re committed to creating a workforce where all individuals can do their best work. It’s when everyone’s voice is heard and valued that we’re inspired to go beyond what’s been done before.
   

  

*https://www.oracle.com/corporate/careers/diversity-inclusion/*
**About Us**
 As a world leader in cloud solutions, Oracle uses tomorrow’s technology to tackle today’s problems. True innovation starts with diverse perspectives and various abilities and backgrounds.
   

  

 When everyone’s voice is heard, we’re inspired to go beyond what’s been done before. It’s why we’re committed to expanding our inclusive workforce that promotes diverse insights and perspectives.
   

  

 We’ve partnered with industry-leaders in almost every sector—and continue to thrive after 40+ years of change by operating with integrity.
   

  

 Oracle careers open the door to global opportunities where work-life balance flourishes. We offer a highly competitive suite of employee benefits designed on the principles of parity and consistency. We put our people first with flexible medical, life insurance and retirement options. We also encourage employees to give back to their communities through our volunteer programs.
   

  

 We’re committed to including people with disabilities at all stages of the employment process. If you require accessibility assistance or accommodation for a disability at any point, let us know by calling +1 888 404 2494, option one.
   

  

**Disclaimer:**
 Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer\*. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans’ status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Oracle will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records pursuant to applicable law.
   

  

* Which includes being a United States Affirmative Action Employer

title: Project Manager (Buildings/ESG)
description:
**About JLL**
 We are JLL. We’re a professional services and investment management firm specializing in real estate. We’re committed to our purpose to shape the future of real estate for a better world. Our mission is to help organizations around the world achieve their ambitions by owning, occupying and investing in real estate.
   

  

 If you’re looking to step up your career, JLL is the perfect professional home. At JLL, you’ll have a chance to innovate with the world’s leading businesses, put that expertise into action on landmark projects, and work on game-changing real estate initiatives. You’ll also make long-lasting professional connections through sharing different perspectives, and you’ll be inspired by the best. We’re focused on opportunity and want to help you make the most of yours. Achieve your ambitions – join us at JLL!
   

  

**We are looking for a TDD/ESG Specialist to strengthen our Swedish Building Consultancy & ESG team**
**About Project And Development Services (PDS)**
 JLL is a world class real estate development partner for our investor and corporate clients. Our services affect how millions of people live, work, and play every day. It is our responsibility to nurture the impact we can have on all projects and bring value into every detail. From technical due diligence to sustainability and development advisory, from project and cost management for fit-out projects to refurbishments and major base-build schemes, our services span every dimension across all asset types, sectors and regions.
   

  

 JLL’s PDS team comprises 8,900 project managers, engineers, designers and architects across 50 countries and is actively managing 36,900+ projects yearly. Join the PDS team to expect more and achieve more. There’s room for you to design and build your career within the PDS community and the wider JLL ecosystem.
   

  

 In Sweden, PDS comprises of project managers within the Building Consultancy, Corporate Project Management, Development Advisory and Construction Management teams. The Building Consultancy team has a major focus on assisting clients in undertaking Technical & Environmental Due Diligence (TEDD) assessments prior to acquisition or disposal of assets. In addition, our team undertake ESG assessments as part of transactions or as part of improvement strategies post-acquisition to improve assets from a sustainability and value perspective.
   

  

 JLLs Building Consultancy team want to expand further to meet increased demands from clients in helping with TEDD assessments and especially ESG related queries. We assist both global and local Nordic clients in transaction advisory and asset improvement strategies concerning ESG and sustainability related items. ESG and sustainability services include but are not limited to EPC uplift assessments, energy saving and improvement calculations, building certifications, Net-Zero carbon assessments including CRREM analysis as well as climate risk assessments and EU Taxonomy compliance.
   

  

**Main Responsibilities**
 Within the Building Consultancy department, you will provide technical advisory services for and on behalf of property companies/funds, investors and public players. Projects can vary between small scale single properties to large portfolios throughout EMEA. We are actively seeking a TDD/ESG specialist who wants to become an integral part of our diverse and talented Building Consultancy team. We summarise below the main responsibilities:
   

  

* Meaningful Impact: As a TDD/ESG specialist, you will play a critical role in helping clients make sound investment decisions by assessing the condition of the building and technical installations, providing CAPEX cost estimates, and give strategic advice to help clients in determining go/no-go decisions before acquisition/disposal.
* Key Skills: You are proficient in preparing technical reports and cost estimates such as condition surveys, maintenance plans and due diligence assessments. You actively seek new client contacts and leads and business opportunities. Your key skills in technical report writing and active client engagement will be put into action daily as you create new business opportunities, undertake assessments, and provide valuable insights to clients in a timely manner.
* Focus on ESG and Sustainability: Familiarity with building certification systems such as BREEAM, Miljöbyggnad. Ideally, you have worked with some of these systems or have experience in conducting assessments and identifying improvements. As a TDD/ESG specialist, you will be involved in energy-saving assessments (EPC improvement) and reducing the carbon impact of assets (via CRREM/LCA assessments).
* Wider Sustainability Services: You will actively collaborate with team members assisting with environmental desktop assessments (EDD), climate risk assessments, Life Cycle Assessments (LCA), EU Taxonomy and CSRD.


**Experience And Knowledge**
* Minimum two years’ experience working in property branch including some experience with TEDD projects, sustainable development, maintenance planning, facilities management and/or project management.
* Demonstrate a keen interest in identifying opportunities for improvements relating to cost and energy savings
* Exhibit fluent proficiency in spoken and written English and Swedish.
* Have experience with or a strong interest in working with building certification systems such as BREEAM, Miljöbyggnad. Familiarity with EPC systems including improvement assessments and recommendations.


**Personal qualities**
 You should have the ability to quickly form an overall picture of complex issues and are not afraid to make decisions. As a person, you describe yourself as prestige less and easy to work with. For the role, it is important that you are someone who can build and maintain good relationships with colleagues and clients while taking great pride in doing a good job, at all levels. Furthermore, we believe that you:
   

  

* Have the ability to handle the demands of managing multiple projects simultaneously with tight deadlines.
* Appreciate and thrive in an international corporate environment, leveraging cultural diversity and global perspectives. Are business driven with a holistic approach
* Are outgoing and a good networker and relationship builder. See opportunities, enjoys challenges and has a positive attitude. Have energy, perseverance, and an inner drive. Have a high level of commitment, initiative, and flexibility


**Teamworking and active collaboration within JLL;**
* You enjoy working within teams throughout Europe and with different business lines within JLL (Capital Markets, Valuation, Leasing, Debt&Financing) to create value for clients and help them in determining strategy and targets regarding ESG matters and investment decisions
* Collaborate with colleagues to identify and secure new project opportunities, effectively presenting and selling the company's services.
* Contribute to the continuous development of internal structures and processes, streamlining project workflows and enhancing overall efficiency.


**What You Can Expect From Us**
 Collaborative and Inclusive Team Environment: We foster a supportive and inclusive team environment where diverse perspectives are valued, and ideas are encouraged. Join our team and contribute to a culture of collaboration, mutual respect, and innovation.
   

  

 Travel and Networking Opportunities: This role offers the opportunity to work on projects across the Nordics, allowing you to broaden your professional horizons and establish valuable connections within the industry. You will have the possibility to expand your network of clients and contacts, creating new opportunities and projects (within Nordics but also EMEA).
   

  

 Professional Development: We offer training programs to ensure that our team members are up to date with the latest industry standards (including building certification training plus JLL ESG training). You will have the opportunity to enhance your knowledge and skills to further advance your career.
   

  

 You will be involved in growing our project management business. You will be involved in providing strategic advice to many of Sweden’s and some of the world’s largest property and asset management funds in relation to Due Diligence and sustainability (via energy improvements).
   

  

 You will work in an international and interdisciplinary work environment together with many competent and ambitious colleagues. JLL will strive to enable you to develop via introducing you team members throughout EMEA who work with similar fields to build collaboration and improve services for clients.
   

  

 You’ll join an entrepreneurial, inclusive culture. One where we succeed together – across the desk and around the globe. Where like-minded people work naturally together to achieve great things.
   

  

 Our Total Rewards program reflects our commitment to helping you achieve your ambitions in career, recognition (including bonus system), wellbeing, benefits and pay.
   

  

 Apply today at jll.com/careers.
   

  

**JLL Corporate Solutions AB**
**Tom Lord**
**Head of Building Consultancy (TEDD GDD ESG)**
 Tom.lord@jll.com

title: Associate Account Manager - Nordic Market
description:
Kaseya® is the leading provider of complete IT infrastructure and security management solutions for Managed Service Providers (MSPs) and internal IT organizations worldwide powered by AI. Kaseya’s best-in-breed technologies allow organizations to efficiently manage and secure IT to drive sustained business success. Kaseya has achieved sustained, strong double-digit growth over the past several years and is backed by Insight Venture Partners www.insightpartners.com), a leading global private equity firm investing in high-growth technology and software companies that drive transformative change in the industries they serve.
   

  

 Founded in 2000, Kaseya currently serves customers in over 20 countries across a wide variety of industries and manages over 15 million endpoints worldwide. To learn more about our company and our award-winning solutions, go to www.Kaseya.com and for more information on Kaseya’s culture, please click here: Kaseya Culture.
   

  

 Kaseya is not your typical company. We are not afraid to tell you exactly who we are and our expectations. We have achieved record levels of success being BOLD, being GRITTY, being ACCOUNTABLE. The thousands of people that succeed at Kaseya are prepared to go above and beyond for the betterment of our customers, and the betterment of their careers and long-term financial wealth.
   

  

 Are you a proactive, results-oriented individual looking to accelerate your career in software sales? If you thrive in a consultative sales culture with ample advancement opportunities and executive support, Kaseya Is the place to be. The thousands of people that succeed at Kaseya are prepared to go above and beyond for the betterment of our customers, and the betterment of their careers and long-term financial wealth.
   

  

**As an Account Manager at Kaseya, you will:**
* Be responsible for proactively engaging with clients to understand their evolving needs and business objectives. This includes learning about their business, initiating regular communications to anticipate challenges, and providing preemptive solutions to enhance customer experience.
* Partner closely with customers to identify cross-sell and upsell opportunities, leveraging additional features or services to drive revenue growth.
* You will also identify expansion opportunities within existing accounts and work with customers to align strategies for mutual success.
* Monitor usage metrics and address any potential adoption hurdles proactively, adhering to sales checklists, processes, and timelines to effectively execute cross-sell, upsell, and expansion strategies.
* Be driven by communication, relationships and sales. You understand that the quality of your customer relationship has a direct correlation to the achievement of your sales goals.


 To excel in this role, you will develop an understanding of our products and their integrations, allowing you to propose their value to customers effectively. You will proactively educate customers on new features, updates, and best practices, providing personalized sessions to ensure they optimize the full potential of IT Complete. Collaboration with specialists and other teams will be essential to engage customers in product value and drive sales.
   

  

 Furthermore, you will collaborate cross-functionally to support teams to address customer needs, acting as the voice of the customer to influence continuous improvements. You will participate in proactive meetings to align strategies and enhance customer experiences, supporting the onboarding process for new clients and driving proactive product adoption through tailored strategies and action plans.
   

  

 This role offers a stimulating environment where you can continuously learn and grow, with opportunities for education and training to enhance your sales skills and product expertise.
   

  

**Requirements:**
* 1+ years’ experience in B2B/B2C sales
* Able to hold business level conversations in any Nordic language
* Driven, passionate about sales, and eager to earn significant sales commissions
* Exceptional inside sales experience in a metrics driven, fast-paced sales environment
* Has a proven track record of crushing sales goals
* A motivated, coachable and competitive go-getter, a resilient achiever driven to win and excel
* An energetic team player with exceptional organizational, interpersonal, and communication skills
* Create weekly, monthly and rolling 6 weeks’ sales forecasts.
* Exposure to CRM applications (Salesforce) to successfully manage leads, opportunities and accounts


 If you are a resilient achiever, driven to win and excel, and meet the above qualifications, Kaseya would like to speak with you about joining our team to empower our customers' efficiency, profitability, and success through our award-winning IT Complete™ platform of products and solutions, driving our hyper-growth trajectory.
   

  

 IND2
   

  

 Join the Kaseya growth rocket ship and see how we are #ChangingLives !
   

  

**Additional Information**
*Kaseya provides equal employment opportunity to all employees and applicants without regard to race, religion, age, ancestry, gender, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, veteran status, marital status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.*

title: Mekaniker
description:
Vill du ha ett jobb där du verkligen gör skillnad? Nynas erbjuder en varierande och utvecklande arbetsmiljö där du får möjlighet att växa och forma din egen karriär. Vi söker nu en driven och teknikintresserad mekaniker till vårt team Maintenance Technical Service i Nynäshamn.
   

  

 Om du har ett stort intresse för mekanik, gillar att lösa problem och vill vara en del av ett sammansvetsat team, då kan detta vara jobbet för dig.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Som mekaniker hos oss har du ett varierande arbete där du får arbeta med både förebyggande och akut underhåll av vår mekaniska utrustning. Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter inkluderar:
   

  

* Säkerställa driften och bidra till en säker och effektiv anläggning
* Felsökning och reparation
* Avancerade renoveringar och förbättringsarbeten
* Underhålla statisk- och roterande utrustning
* Arbeta med kvalitets- och miljöförbättrande åtgärder


 I arbetet kan, beroende på din kompetens, beredskap på kvällar, nätter och helger komma att ingå. Beredskapen är upplagd efter ett rullande schema och innebär att du ska kunna inställa dig med kort varsel för att kunna utföra felsökning och akut avhjälpande underhåll.
   

  

**Om dig**
 Vi letar efter dig som har en bakgrund som exempelvis industrimekaniker, bilmekaniker eller lastbilstekniker. Oavsett om du har flera års erfarenhet eller är i början av din karriär, värderar vi ditt intresse för mekanik och din vilja till att utvecklas. Det som är viktigast för oss är att du har en vana av att mecka och serva och trivs med ett praktiskt arbete och det är en mindre betydelse kring hur du har skaffat den erfarenheten. Utöver detta behöver du ha ett stort engagemang, nyfikenhet och en vilja till att lära sig för att passa in i teamet.
   

  

 För att lyckas i denna roll är det även viktigt att du är ansvarstagande och säkerhetsmedveten. Du är en lagspelare med ett genuint intresse för att arbeta med både människor och teknik.
   

  

 Du blir en del av ett mindre team. ”- Här på Nynas är alla i teamet väldigt engagerade i gruppen, vi ställer upp för och vill varandra väl. Det är en familjär känsla och högt i tak”, säger Edward, mekaniker i teamet.
   

  

 För att kunna söka rollen ser vi att du har:
   

  

* En gymnasial examen med verkstadsteknisk inriktning, fordons- och transportprogrammet eller motsvarande.
* Grundläggande kunskaper kring pumpar, kompressorer, växellådor etc.
* Speciellt meriterande om du har erfarenhet och kunskaper kring underhåll och kontroll av säkerhetsventiler.
* Goda kunskaper i både svenska och engelska
* Goda IT-kunskaper.
* Kan läsa och förstå ritningar och annan teknisk dokumentation.
* En god samarbetsförmåga och likaså kommunikation
* B-körkort.
* Meriterande om du har tidigare erfarenhet ifrån en processindustri.


**Om Nynas**
**Framåt för en hållbar samhällsomställning**
 Nynas är ett specialkemikalieföretag som producerar högpresterande bitumen och nafteniska lösningar avgörande för infrastruktur, elektrifiering och andra industriella tillämpningar. Med huvudfokus på Europa spelar våra produkter en nyckelroll i övergången mot en hållbar framtid. Genom strategiska partnerskap och ett starkt engagemang för säkerhet och effektivitet har Nynas en positiv inverkan på samhället och miljön.
   

  

**Kontakt och ansökan**
 Urval görs löpande, så tjänsten kan tillsättas innan annonsens sista datum.

title: Commercial Channel GTM Manager - Qualcomm - Sweden
description:
**Company**
 Arriver Software AB
   

  

**Job Area**
 Sales, Business Development & Marketing Group, Sales, Business Development & Marketing Group > Business Development
   

  

**General Summary**
 At Qualcomm, we invent breakthrough technologies that transform how the world connects, computes, and communicates. For over 35 years, Qualcomm has been the world’s leading wireless technology innovator and the driving force behind the development, launch, and expansion of 5G. We perfected processing for the smartphone, and now encompass many different verticals and products. From compute to automotive to gaming—you’ll find Snapdragon branded technologies making a difference. In 2023, we launched Snapdragon X Series - the most powerful, intelligent, and efficient processor for Windows in its class. Designed for this next era of modern AI computing, these cutting-edge devices deliver unparalleled performance, multi-day battery life, and advanced AI capabilities, redefining the personal computing experience.
   

  

 As a Commercial Channel GTM Manager you will engage across a select portfolio of Distributors and leading Channel Partners to define strategic marketing programs and GTM plans that drive market awareness, preference, and demand for Snapdragon-based compute devices in the Commercial Channel. You will collaborate with Channel counterparts including Marketing, CAMs and OEMs to develop and implement omni-channel marketing programs, joint OEM campaigns, demand generation initiatives, pipeline acceleration activities, seller enablement motions as well as joint PR and event marketing that deliver significant ROI and meet performance goals.
   

  

 This role requires a strategic thinker with excellent relationship-building skills and a strong understanding of commercial channels and tactics as well as a comprehensive knowledge of the IT industry – with strong focus on the PC B2B Channel. This is a fast-paced role where you will work with multiple teams across various time zones. The ideal candidate has in-depth knowledge of the regional market and expertise in driving customers through the GTM funnel. They possess extensive experience in developing and managing marketing, enablement, & sales engagement programs and GTM plans across multiple partners and have a proven track record in scaling sales enablement efforts to drive partner awareness and advocacy.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
**Channel Relationship & Partner Management**
* Develop and support execution of quarterly GTM plans in collaboration with Commercial Channel Partners and Account Management team to enhance brand visibility, customer engagement, and drive revenue growth.
* Foster and expand relationships with the Partner’s Marketing, OEM, and PAMs, and lead regularly scheduled meetings to ensure campaign and program alignment and execution.
* Articulate the Snapdragon value proposition to the Partners Marketing & Partner Management organizations to ensure the benefits of Snapdragon resonate via the various channel programs.
* Work with the Partner’s Partner Management team to adapt marketing, enablement, and sales material to fit their audience - inclusive of email, social, banner ads, videos, content syndication, training materials, sales tools, etc.
* Manage quarterly investment plans for GTM related activities ensuring ROI targets are achieved.
* Manage the approval process for Partner assets to ensure all Partner-created content and assets comply with Qualcomm brand guidelines and GTM messaging.


 OEM
   

  

* Drive cross-functional collaboration to strengthen OEM partnerships at country level and ensure alignment on all regional GTM activities.
* Build relationships with Partner OEM managers to ensure cohesive communication and alignment between the Channel Partner, Qualcomm, and the OEMs.
* Identify relevant cross-collaboration activities to drive the sellout of Snapdragon-based devices, ensuring Snapdragon is represented appropriately in marketing materials.
* Leverage OEM relationships to gain regional insights on products and market and build a credible knowledge base within the organization.


**HQ/Sweden**
* Collaborate with the HQ Product and Partner Marketing teams and the regional Account Management team to understand the Snapdragon value proposition for the category and the product roadmap.
* Provide regular updates to the WW and regional leadership teams on Partner GTM plans, activities, and success metrics, working closely with the regional Account Team and Channel Partners to measure the ROI of MDF investment.
* Work with the regional Account Team to understand and prioritize partnerships based on defined targets and align GTM plans to strategic focus in the region.
* Build and maintain a strong network with the HQ Business, Marketing, PR, Social, Digital, Channel Training, and Brand teams to ensure that brand identity, messaging, and processes are seamlessly integrated into our regional go-to-market strategies and tactics.
* Manage & report on end-to-end GTM performance KPIs & metrics that contribute to the overall global commercial channel organization performance.


**Campaign Management**
* Develop and implement marketing campaigns, strategies, and tactics to promote the sellout of Windows on Snapdragon-based devices in collaboration with OEMs and Channel Partners.
* Identify key verticals, target audiences, and KPIs for each campaign to track and measure success.
* Work closely with Channel Partners to identify the sales funnel and lead qualification flow, ensuring relevant leads are nurtured by Channel Sales teams.
* Collect and report on post-campaign metrics from Channel Partners to monitor the performance of spend.


**Event Management**
* Collaborate with Channel Partners and OEMs to identify relevant tradeshows and customer-facing events that resonate with their audience and incorporate these into the GTM plans.
* Develop a comprehensive event plan in collaboration with the Channel Marketing teams and their agency, covering aspects such as timings, venue, build cost, content, invitations, and attendee list.
* Coordinate with the Qualcomm Marketing and PDM teams to identify and integrate relevant Qualcomm content for presentations to drive the Snapdragon value proposition.
* Host pre-event kick-offs and post-event debriefs, and report on post-event metrics to track ROI.


**Skills/Experience**
* 8 + years Commercial Channel GTM and Marketing experience in tech companies.
* Strong understanding of how the Commercial Channel and OEMs operate and sell, possess a deep understanding of the marketing funnel and tactics, as well as lead generation and nurturing tactics and tools.
* Experience in negotiating and managing MDF Programs.
* Skilled in defining and executing Commercial and Channel programs to effectively drive customers down the funnel.
* Creative problem solving with strong analytical and project management skills.
* Ability to communicate and evangelize both internally and externally.
* Proven experience in working on new projects and establishing new ways of working.
* Comfortable driving cross-functional team alignment to create a comprehensive plan, identifying dependencies and critical issues/paths.
* Experience in analyzing and reporting on the effectiveness of marketing, sales enablement, and incentive programs and GTM plans and adjusting strategies as needed within established KPIs.


**Preferred Qualifications**
* 10+ years of Commercial Channel and marketing experience in tech companies.
* Master's degree in business or technology is preferred.
* Business level English and Swedish is required, additional languages a plus.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Proven ability to build trusting, collaborative relationships and rapport with senior business stakeholders & Channel Partners.
* Strong capability to convey information clearly and accurately with great credibility.
* Highly organized, resourceful, and adaptable.
* References to a particular number of years experience are for indicative purposes only. Applications from candidates with equivalent experience will be considered, provided that the candidate can demonstrate an ability to fulfill the principal duties of the role and possesses the required competencies.


 Qualcomm is an equal opportunity employer. If you are an individual with a disability and need an accommodation during the application/hiring process, rest assured that Qualcomm is committed to providing an accessible process. You may e-mail disability-accomodations@qualcomm.com or call Qualcomm's toll-free number found here. Upon request, Qualcomm will provide reasonable accommodations to support individuals with disabilities to be able participate in the hiring process. Qualcomm is also committed to making our workplace accessible for individuals with disabilities. (Keep in mind that this email address is used to provide reasonable accommodations for individuals with disabilities. We will not respond here to requests for updates on applications or resume inquiries).
   

  

 Qualcomm expects its employees to abide by all applicable policies and procedures, including but not limited to security and other requirements regarding protection of Company confidential information and other confidential and/or proprietary information, to the extent those requirements are permissible under applicable law.
   

  

**To all Staffing and Recruiting Agencies:** 
 Our Careers Site is only for individuals seeking a job at Qualcomm. Staffing and recruiting agencies and individuals being represented by an agency are not authorized to use this site or to submit profiles, applications or resumes, and any such submissions will be considered unsolicited. Qualcomm does not accept unsolicited resumes or applications from agencies. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Qualcomm employees or any other company location. Qualcomm is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes/applications.
   

  

 If you would like more information about this role, please contact Qualcomm Careers.
   

  

**3070683**
