title: Deep Learning Engineer
company_industry: Technology, Information and Internet and Information Services
description:
At Univrses we develop computer vision and machine learning technology for smart cities, and self-driving vehicles. Univrses is now looking for a Deep Learning Engineer to join the team in Stockholm!
   

  

 Our product 3DAI™ revolutionizes urban and highway road management by providing timely, actionable insights about road conditions through AI powered live maps. As a result it empowers businesses, municipalities, and road transport authorities to make data-driven decisions, optimize their operations, and increase urban safety.
   

  

 The team consists of talented, hard-working, and friendly people from all over the world with diverse backgrounds and expert knowledge in computer vision, robotics, machine learning, physics, math, software development and more. We develop cutting edge technology, particularly in the fields of computer vision and deep learning.
   

  

**Your role**
 You will be part of the team responsible for the data curation, computer vision, and deep learning components of 3DAI™.
   

  

 We are looking for a person who is knowledgeable in the state of the art in deep learning, and has a strong interest in applying their knowledge to real-world problems. They also recognize the importance of data quality and automation in building scalable, reliable systems, and are eager to contribute to the development of high-quality, user-friendly tools for these systems.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Develop and test deep learning models for object detection, classification, and segmentation.
* Streamline the deployment and scaling of computer vision models in production environments.
* Design and implement monitoring and logging solutions to track the performance of our system on both controlled test sets and in the wild.
* Develop learning based methods to ease data curation and annotation through automation.
* Work closely with other teams to develop end to end KPIs for performance monitoring and trouble shooting.
* Optimize and scale ML infrastructure to handle large volumes of image data efficiently.


**Who You Are**
* Minimum of a Master's degree in Computer Science, Math, Physics, Robotics, or a related field.
* Over 5 years of proven experience in developing computer vision or deep learning technologies.
* Proficient in programming, particularly Python, and experienced with ML frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch).
* Strong theoretical foundation in deep learning and best practices.
* Solid understanding of version control systems, especially Git.
* Exceptional communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to thrive in a team-oriented environment.
* Self-motivated with a keen focus on quality and scalability.
* Motivated to see your ideas brought to life in production.
* Flexible, eager to learn, and excited to take on diverse tech challenges.


**Bonus points**
* Knowledge of classical computer vision and projective geometry.
* Experience with data annotation and curation tools such as Labelbox, and Voxel 51.
* Experience with AWS and Serverless frameworks, or other cloud platforms.
* Experience with containerization and developing CI/CD pipelines.
* Experience with Jenkins.


**What We Offer** 
  

  

* Bright and spacious facilities in the heart of Stockholm
* Open and friendly work environment
* A diverse, international, and friendly team
* Generous employee benefits, such as:
+ Flexible work hours
+ 5 000 SEK/year in wellness grant
+ Pension plan
+ Weekly Lunch and Learns
+ Possibility to work from home and/or the office in Hammarby Kaj, Stockholm


**Next step**
 If you are passionate about computer vision and deep learning and want to be part of our team, please submit your resume and a cover letter detailing your relevant experience. All application material must be in English!

title: System Test Engineer
description:
***System Test Engineer within Automotive***




 We live and breathe innovation – We enjoy the ride
 



  





  





*CabinAir aims to improve the health, safety, and wellbeing of drivers and passengers, by producing industry-leading in-cabin air purification solutions for cars, trucks, buses, and other vehicles.* 




  





*We are looking for a System Test Engineer within Automotive to be part of our journey when we expand our businesses.* 




  





**What you'll do** 




*Join CabinAir and revolutionize clean air in cars as a Systems Test Engineer, you will play a key role in transforming stakeholder requirements and expectations into system test requirements for verification and validation. You will lead system testing activities, ensuring structure and coherence across product variants and customer specifications. Acting as a quality gate, you will ensure that deliverables from design partners and suppliers meet the highest standards before reaching our customers.* 




  





**Overall responsibilities:** 



* **Collaborative leadership:** 
 Support, inform, and clarify target product performance and characteristics to be verified and validated. Guide engineers with your expertise and best practices.
* **Requirements understanding:** 
 Evaluate the feasibility and applicability of requirements through cross-functional analysis of product design and applicable standards, translating them into system verification and validation tests.
* **Requirements control:** 
 Ensure structured traceability and control between requirements, verification, and validation, leveraging internal tools for support.
* **Customer engagement:** 
 Lead alignment with customers and suppliers on system functions, performance, requirements, and expectations.



**Who you are** 




 As a person, you have the ability to get things done, with a strong focus on customer needs and a passion for delivering high-quality standards. It is important that you have excellent collaborative skills and take the initiative to solve tasks. The position requires that you are thorough, structured, and can express yourself clearly in English, both orally and in writing.
 



  





 Qualifications:
 


* Academic degree in engineering or a related field
* At least 5 years of experience in systems test engineering, preferably within the automotive industry or other regulated industries with high standards.
* Strong organizational and communication skills
* An electronic hardware/software background is a plus
* Prior experience in system verification of embedded systems is also an advantage
* Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail
* Fluent in both written- and oral English



  





 You will report to Head of R&D, with daily interactions with the R&D team in Sweden and China as well as PMO, Operations and Sales & Marketing.
 



  





**Who we are** 




 We are proud to be pioneers. From the start, we’ve had the most advanced air purification technology. We are constantly experiencing the joy of innovation as we challenge conventional thinking, and we are dedicated to delivering solutions that contribute to the health and well-being of drivers and passengers everywhere. Based at Headquarter in Stockholm where all functions are represented, we are an international fast expanding team of passionate and committed employees with factory and R&D in Shenzhen and sales offices in Shanghai and Los Angeles. In total, we are about 80 passionate CabinAir employees.
 



  





 Our technology is already on the road in Volvo Cars, some of the world’s most highly regarded vehicles in terms of driver and passenger health and safety, as an integral part of Volvo Cars’ Advanced Air Cleaner (AAC) system. Now, the Polestar 3 also features our AAC technology, showcasing our commitment to delivering cleaner air in premium electric vehicles. Recently, we’ve signed agreements with additional premium manufacturers in Europe, the U.S., and China. At the same time, we’re making our solutions accessible for cars already on the road.
 



  





**The next step** 




 Do you find this interesting, and do you agree with our values Proud, Quality, Character and Dedicated? If yes, please send your application
 **not later than 28 Mars 2025** 
 (interviews take place continuously).
 



 Please note that all applicants must possess a valid work permit and visa. CabinAir does not provide assistance or sponsorship for obtaining these documents.
 



 We accept only direct job applications for this position (not through recruiting or staffing agencies).
 



 We bring you healthy air for the ride. And the journey has only begun!
 



 Apply today to join the ride.

title: Software Architect
description:
***Software Architect***




 We live and breathe innovation – We enjoy the ride
 



  





*CabinAir aims to improve the health, safety, and wellbeing of drivers and passengers, by producing industry-leading in-cabin air purification solutions for cars, trucks, buses, and other vehicles.* 




  





*We are looking for a SW architect within Automotive to be part of our journey when we expand our businesses.* 




  





**What you'll do** 




*Join CabinAir and revolutionize clean air in cars! As part of our dynamic Global R&D team located in Stockholm and in Shenzhen, China, you'll harness your expertise in SW architect engineering area. You will collaborate and guide both our design partners and manage our automotive OEM customers.* 




  





*You and your colleagues will build and establish a roadmap, making sure we move in the right direction. You'll delve into the nitty-gritty while keeping an eye on the grand vision, guiding everyone towards success. Get ready to make breathing clean air in your car as natural as wearing a seat belt!* 




  





**Overall responsibilities:** 



* Be the key contact person for SW architectural topics to Global OEM automotive customers and SW development partners.
* Perform customer stakeholder requirements analysis and translate into detailed software requirements
* Leading technical decisions as a hands-on SW developer ensuring seamless communication with our development partners and customers.
* Develop a new and existing SW embedded platforms used in ECU to many OEM automotive customers
* Create and communicate software architecture roadmap to Global OEM automotive customers and SW development partners.
* Work closely with global software and hardware engineering partners to ensure efficient architecture
* Excellent problem-solving skills.
* Proffer solutions effective in meeting set targets and satisfying stakeholder requirements



  





**Who you are** 




 We're seeking a tech-savvy and passionate, unpretentious and down-to-earth individual who wants to make a tangible impact on the environment.
 



  





 You thrive in a global atmosphere and excel at engaging people on our transformative journey. With your meticulous attention to detail and a can-do attitude, making sure all the details are in place.
 



  




* Solution and team oriented
* Senior experience of SW architectural work in embedded SW in complex, multi-site and cross-functional projects
* Excellent and proven people leadership skills
* Knowledge of different SW architectural tools and methods.
* Min 8 years of experience of SW architectural work. Automotive industry with embedded SW is preferred.
* Fluent in both written- and oral English
* Excellent communication skills
* Background from SW embedded Development in a technology company



  





**Who we are** 




 We are proud to be pioneers. From the start, we’ve had the most advanced air purification technology. We are constantly experiencing the joy of innovation as we challenge conventional thinking, and we are dedicated to delivering solutions that contribute to the health and well-being of drivers and passengers everywhere. Based at Headquarter in Stockholm where all functions are represented, we are an international fast expanding team of passionate and committed employees with factory and R&D in Shenzhen and sales offices in Shanghai and Los Angeles. In total, we are about 80 passionate CabinAir employees.
 



  





 Our technology is already on the road in Volvo Cars, some of the world’s most highly regarded vehicles in terms of driver and passenger health and safety, as an integral part of Volvo Cars’ Advanced Air Cleaner (AAC) system. Recently Polestar announced AAC for Polestar 3 and we recently signed other contracts with premium vehicle manufacturers from Europe. U.S and China. In parallel, we are launching our technology for cars already on the road.
 



  





**The next step** 




 Do you find this interesting, and do you agree with our values Proud, Quality, Character and Dedicated? If yes, please send your application not later than 6 April 2025 (interviews take place continuously).
 



  





 Please note that all applicants must hold Swedish citizenship, due to the nature of the position.
 



 We accept only direct job applications for this position (not through recruiting or staffing agencies).
 



  





 We bring you healthy air for the ride. And the journey has only begun!
 



  





 Apply today to join the ride.

title: System Developer
company_industry: Information Services and Technology, Information and Media
description:

**Location** 
 : Stockholm, Sweden

 :
 



 We are looking for an experienced System Developer to work on data analysis, aggregation, and visualization solutions. The role involves writing maintainable code and implementing secure, end-to-end data solutions.

title: Online Game Programmer (C++) - Game Services
description:
As an Online Game Programmer at Embark, you will be working on our recently announced games ARC Raiders and THE FINALS, alongside some of the most talented people in the games industry.
   

  

 You will be a part of Game Services, a strategic team with mixed competences, and we provide online services and integration to our games. We work closely with the game teams and deliver online services to a high quality and make sure they are operational.
   

  

 Examples of such services are Persistent Inventory, Friends, Voice Chat, Anti-Cheat, Progression and Store.
   

  

 The games are being built in Unreal Engine, using C++, a scripting language called Angelscript and some blueprints.
   

  

**Example Of Responsibilities**
* Create the core metagame systems for our games
* Collaborate with game designers to find innovative new ways to engage our players
* Design and develop the friends, party and chat systems
* Use data as a guide when designing matchmaking rules


**We would love if you have**
* A creative and curious mind
* A strong background in C++
* An ambition in pushing the boundaries of "next gen"
* A good grasp of what social and metagame looks and feels like
* A fluent English - our team comes from all over the world
* An interest in computer science and programming as a craft


**Additionally one or some of these would be a great bonus**
* Professional experience with Online systems in games
* Experience working with or close to game design
* Backend services development experience


 At Embark we offer competitive salaries, passionate colleagues to share knowledge with and much more, but most of all we invite you to take part of a journey into the unknown, to build creative, surprising and beautiful experiences together.
   

  

 We welcome game makers of all sex, class, colour, age, gender identity, education, religion, opinion, culture, nation of origin, language, sexual orientation, shape, size, and ability.
   

  

 Did we leave anyone out? Well, we welcome you, too! We think that the gaming industry is made better when everyone has a seat at the table.
   

  

 Be yourself at Embark and make games while doing so. Please apply with confidence. We can’t wait to hear from you (in English)!

title: Applied Ai Engineer
description:
**YOUR MISSION AT VOI**
 As the
 **Applied AI Engineer** 
 , you will play an important role in unlocking the potential of Gen AI throughout our organisation. Your hands-on approach and focus on applying Gen AI to address real-world challenges will be key in driving innovation and efficiency. This role offers a platform for you to make a significant impact, with the freedom to execute on our Gen AI strategy, discover high-value applications, and take lead on technical implementation.
   

  

**Role**
 Imagine building transformative solutions like implementing real-time actions based on rider feedback from the app or creating a diagnosis and repairs co-pilot for mechanics and in-field workers. These are just a glimpse of the exciting and impactful projects you will spearhead in this role, shaping the way we leverage AI technology. This will include:
   

  

* Developing frameworks and tooling that make it easier for R&D teams to integrate Gen AI into products.
* Designing and building pragmatic, production-ready Gen AI solutions for various business use cases.
* Working with teams across the company to understand their challenges and apply AI where it creates real value.
* Balancing innovation with practicality, ensuring we use the right AI tools for the job rather than chasing the latest trends.
* Ensuring solutions are scalable, cost-efficient, and secure, following best practices for deploying AI in production.
* Staying up to date with the rapidly evolving AI landscape and helping define our AI adoption strategy.


**What You Need To Embark**
 To have the best possible start with us, we believe you have:
   

  

* Software engineering background, ideally in backend or ML development and system integration.
* Experience using Gen AI/LLM technologies in production (e.g., OpenAI, Claude, Gemini, vector databases, RAG, AI agents).
* Curiosity and pragmatism – you focus on delivering value, not just exploring technology.
* Experience building AI-powered applications that integrate with real-world systems.
* Ability to work autonomously, define your own roadmap, and drive projects forward.
* Strong collaboration skills – comfortable working with technical and non-technical teams alike.


**WHY VOI?**
 Working At Voi Is More Than Just a Job; Our People Promise Includes a Personal Voyage Where You Will Grow As a Professional And Be a Part Of a Team And Culture That Builds Something Meaningful For Society. In Addition To This You’ll Have The Opportunity To
   

  

* Join Europe’s #1 micromobility operator and one of the fastest growing scaleups
* Get “skin in the game” through our employee options program
* Lead the future product generations of our vehicles and push the company further towards our product vision and overarching mission of providing “safe, affordable and sustainable micromobility for everyone”
* Join the micromobility-revolution and be a part of creating sustainable cities made for living, free from noise and pollution


 Since 2018,
 **Voi** 
 has been on a mission to create safe, sustainable and reliable micromobility for everyone. Today we are the leading shared micromobility operator in Europe, with HQ in Stockholm (Sweden), operating 100,000+ vehicles in 100+ towns and cities across 12 countries, serving 7+ million riders with over 300+ MILLION rides to date, and we have no intention of stopping here! We believe that micromobility will play a central role in changing how people move in our towns and cities in the future and want to ensure that the micromobility transformation happens the right way - through real innovative technology, partnership and transparent dialogue with towns, cities and governments, and by adapting our products to the local needs. In addition to improving quality of life in cities around the world, we are contributing to the solution for climate change by making sustainable transportation options more widely available and promoting renewable energy use and circularity along our supply chain.
   

  

**Diversity Matters**
 As a Voiager, we offer you a friendly and fast-paced workplace where you can bring your whole self to work, regardless of gender, age, ethnicity, religion, disability or sexual orientation - and welcome applications from whoever you are, including veterans, those actively serving as a Reservist and their partners. What is most important to us is how you treat others and what skills and value you bring to our team. We believe that having a wide diversity of people with different backgrounds and perspectives within Voi is essential to our success in delivering the best user experience to our equally diverse user base. With employees from over 50 nationalities working within Voi, we believe we have made good progress but know we can still do more - therefore we discourage any photos, personal letters, or disclosure of any information that concerns other information than your professional experience.

title: Quality Assurance Engineer
description:
We know it, you know it. Most companies ramble on about purpose and making the world a better place. And pretty often it feels a bit… well, forced. But we’d like to think that our story is special for real.
 



  





 Our founders, Shadi Bitar and Ninos Malki, came to Sweden from Syria when they were kids. Books became their compass, guiding them through the maze of life and helping them shape their destinies in a new world.
 



  





 Their dream was bold: What if they could unlock the world of books for everyone, making knowledge and inspiration accessible to all? Fast forward a few years, and the tale of Nextory was born.
 



  





 At Nextory, we've crafted a revolutionary monthly subscription that empowers our users to devour books like never before, be it through reading or listening. It's not just a product; it's a passport to endless adventure and enlightenment.
 



  





 And now, we're on a quest to find
 **our QA Engineer – Mobile** 
 Apps, someone as passionate as we are about making the world a happier place and enriching lives through the world of reading. Join our extraordinary team, and let’s script a future where every day is a chapter of discovery, and every book is a key to a richer life.
 



  





 This position is based in Stockholm.
 



  





**WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING** 




**As a QA Engineer – Mobile** 
 Apps at Nextory, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the quality of our mobile applications, delivering the best possible experience for our users. You will be responsible for designing, implementing, and executing automated and manual tests to guarantee a delightful experience in our iPhone and Android apps.
 



  





 You will:
 



 - Develop and execute test cases, scripts, and plans mainly for mobile applications, but also occasionally for the backend serving the apps.
 



 - Work closely with developers, product managers and product designers to define test strategies and ensure high-quality releases.
 



 - Identify, track, and document bugs using industry-standard tools.
 



 - Implement automated testing frameworks for mobile app components.
 



 - Continuously improve testing processes and ensure best practices are followed.
 



 - Analyze application performance and usability to provide feedback for improvement.
 



 - Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure smooth releases and an excellent user experience.
 



  





**WHO YOU ARE** 




 We believe that you are currently working in a similar role at a fast-moving company. You are passionate about quality assurance in mobile applications, ensuring flawless user experiences. You take ownership of your work, enjoy problem-solving, and have an eye for detail. We believe that you take pride in our product, love to drive quality improvements, and always strive for excellence.
 



  





 You thrive in a dynamic and unpretentious environment where you take great responsibility for our product and your team. If you love the idea of combining technology and storytelling to create a seamless reading experience, we would love to have you on board!
 



  





**SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS** 




 - Relevant educational background in Computer Science, Engineering or rela
 



 ted fields
 



 - 3+ years of expe
 **rience in mobile a** 
 pp testing (iOS & Android)
 



 - Proficiency in debugging mobile applications and reporting defects
 



 - Experience working with Android Studio and Xcode
 



 - Kno
 **wledge of CI/CD** 
 pipelines and how to integrate automated tests
 



 - Experience wor
 **king with API tes** 
 ting tools such as Postman or RestAssured
 



 - Familiarity with Agile methodologies and best QA practices
 



 - A detail-oriented mindset and strong problem-solving skills
 



  





 At Nextory, we believe a strong and inclusive culture is key to our success - and that culture flourishes when we meet and collaborate in person as much as possible. That’s why we spend the majority of our working time at our beautiful office!
 



  





 It’s a balance we’re proud of, where building connections, sparking creativity and innovation, and shaping our culture together is at the heart of everything we do.
 



  





**We are looking forward to your** 
 application! Please include your CV or LinkedIn profile, along with a short pitch on why
 **you are the tech-savvy QA Engineer –** 
 Mobile Apps we’re looking for!

title: Data Engineer
description:
Beskrivning av tjänsten
   

  

 Du kommer att bli en del i ett av CGI:s Data Insights team i stockholm, dvs ett av CGI:s analytics team som arbetar med att hjälpa våra kunder att bygga, förvalta och hantera dataplattformar (DW:n, Lakehouses m.m.) och BI lösningar. Vi befinner oss i en tillväxtfas och ska förstärka vårt team inom BI & Analytics i Stockholm.
   

  

 Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 Vi önskar arbeta i teknikens framkant med utmanande uppdrag och vårt mål är att accelerera vår position inom området. Förutom att bli en del i ett av våra vassa team, så erbjuder vi goda möjligheter till att påverka och utforma din roll för att uppnå maximal utveckling.
   

  

 I rollen som Data Engineer kommer du arbeta i ett team där du har möjlighet att jobba med allt ifrån traditionella data warehouse-utveckling, både on-prem men mer och mer i en cloudmiljö, till mer avancerad analys och arkitekturfrågor.
   

  

 Vi samarbetar med stora erkända partners såsom Microsoft, Qlik, Google och Snowflake.
   

  

 Kvalifikationer för att bli framgångsrik denna roll
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet i något av följande områden:
   

  

* DW resp Lakehouse-arkitektur,
* SQL, Python, Spark, Powershellscripts etc.
* MS Azure (Synapse, Data Factory etc.)
* MS Fabric


 Det är också meriterande om du har:
   

  

* Kunskap inom: Databricks, DBT, Snowflake, GCP
* Power BI, Qlik
* 5+ års erfarenhet
* Tidigare konsulterfarenhet
* En högskoleexamen inom IT, systemvetenskap eller Civilingenjörsexamen


 Som person delar du med dig av din kunskap, är ödmjuk, lätt att samarbeta med. Du tar egna initiativ och är en självgående, utåtriktad och affärsmässig lagspelare som vill arbeta med människor och teknik. Vi förutsätter att du behärskar svenska och engelska bra i såväl tal som skrift.
   

  

**Vill du veta mer?**
 Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig! Om det finns något du undrar över, skicka gärna dina funderingar till rekryterande ledare/Konsultchef Christian Carlborg, på christian.carlborg@cgi.com
   

  

 Mer information om våra förmåner:
   

  

* Aktieprogram och delägarskap: Som delägare har du möjlighet att påverka och i vårt aktieprogram matchar CGI ditt bidrag, krona för krona upp till 3% av din månadslön.
* Friskvårdsbidrag: Vi erbjuder ett årligt friskvårdsbidrag på 4 000 kr.
* Föräldralön: Vi betalar upp till cirka 90% av din lön under den första tiden hemma.
* Trygg anställning: Våra konsulter anställs med kollektivavtal och försäkringar.
* Pensionslösningar: Vi erbjuder attraktiva och förmånliga pensionslösningar.
* Personalbil: Personalbilen används som en privatbil men leasas av CGI.


  
   

  

**Om oss**
 CGI är det största konsultbolaget inom digitalisering och verksamhetsutveckling i Göteborg med en global organisation i ryggen.
   

  

 Vår företagskultur präglas av uppmuntran, samarbete och medmänsklighet. Det är högt i tak och finns alltid utrymme för att fånga upp och lyfta initiativ och nya idéer. Vi tror på att mångfald gör oss mer effektiva och kreativa och arbetar aktivt med frågan, varje dag. Vårt team består av affärsmässiga lagspelare som vill arbeta med människor och teknik. För att du ska trivas hos oss behöver du vara en person som tar egna initiativ och ser det som självklart att dela med dig av kunskap för att få andra och även dig själv att växa och utvecklas.
   

  

 Med våra gedigna kunskaper hjälper vi kunder inom såväl privat som offentlig sektor med att möta deras utmaningar på bästa tänkbara sätt. Vi som jobbar här har höga ambitioner och vi brinner vi för kreativa lösningar. Om du delar vår dröm: "Att skapa en miljö där vi trivs med att arbeta tillsammans, och som ägare, bidra till att bygga ett företag som vi kan vara stolta över", då är det dig vi söker!
   

  

**Låt oss som ägare omvandla verklig insikt till handling – tillsammans.**
 Livet på CGI bygger på ägande, lagarbete, respekt och tillhörighet. Tillsammans med oss kommer du att kunna nå din fulla potential.
   

  

 Du är inbjuden att ta ägandeskap redan från första dagen i vårt arbete med att förverkliga vår dröm om att skapa en arbetsmiljö där vi trivs med att arbeta tillsammans och bidrar till framgången för vårt företag. Det är därför vi kallar oss CGI Partners snarare än anställda. Vi drar nytta av vår kollektiva framgång och tillsammans får vi möjlighet att aktivt forma vår företagsstrategi och inriktning.
   

  

 Ditt arbete skapar värde. Du kommer att vara med att utveckla innovativa lösningar och bygga relationer med medarbetare och kunder samtidigt som du får tillgång till globala möjligheter att skala upp dina idéer, omfamna nya möjligheter och dra nytta av gedigen bransch- och teknikexpertis.
   

  

 Du kommer att forma din karriär tillsammans med ett företag som är byggt för att växa och bestå. Du får stöd av ledare som bryr sig om din hälsa och ditt välbefinnande och ger dig möjligheter att fördjupa dina kunskaper och vidga dina vyer.
   

  

 Bli en del en av världens största leverantörer av IT- och affärskonsulttjänster.

title: Erfaren Java-utvecklare till team FlexChange, Solna
company_industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage
description:
*Vill du utveckla tjänster som når hundratusentals kunder i Norden varje dag?* 
*Vi är ett engagerat team med stor teknisk kompetens och erfarenhet, som drivs av att leverera värde till våra kunder och vår affär. Vi söker nu fler erfarna utvecklare som vill bli en del av oss.*
  

  

 Bli en del av Team FlexChange
   

  

* Vi tillhandahåller tjänster med påverkan på hundratusentals kunder och mottagare i Norden varje dag. Det är vårt ansvar att tjänsterna är tillgängliga för våra mottagare via vår webb och PostNord app.
* Vi utvecklar mikrotjänster i Kubernetes.
* Vi har vår infrastruktur i AWS.
* Vi utvecklar webgränssnittet i Vue3.
* Vi har höga krav på kvalitet och robusthet på våra leveranser, då det har direkt påverkan på våra kunder.
* Vi äger våra tjänster, i vått och torrt, och har helhetsansvaret för det vi bygger. Från design, utveckling, testning och användarupplevelse; till övervakning, larm och affärsmetrik.
* Vi driftsätter flera gånger i veckan och vi kan se värdet av det vi gör direkt.
* Vi ansvarar själva för att vårt sätt att arbeta är det bästa för vår leverans och för oss.


 Vem är du?
   

  

* Du är en erfaren utvecklare, med minst fyra års erfarenhet, som drivs av att skapa värde och trivs med att jobba i team i en agil miljö.
* Du vill jobba med backend och är intresserad av användarupplevelsen.
* Du tar ägarskap i det du levererar hela vägen till kund.
* Du gillar att konkret förenkla vardagen för konsumenter, kunder och kollegor.
* Du talar och skriver bra svenska och engelska


 Meriterande kunskaper och erfarenheter
   

  

* Java 21, Spring Boot, Docker, Kubernetes, Redis, DynamoDB, PostgreSQL, CI/CD-pipelines, AWS, Prometheus, Grafana, Cucumber, TypeScript, Vue3
* REST-tjänster och säkerhet
* Utveckling av distribuerade system där både datamängd, prestanda och tillgänglighet är en stor del av utmaningen
* Utveckling av meddelandedrivna tjänster
* Infrastructure-as-code, till exempel AWS CloudFormation
* Testdriven utveckling
* Akademisk utbildning; gärna systemvetenskap, datavetenskap eller motsvarade erfarenhet


 Vi erbjuder dig
   

  

* Att vara en del av ett trevligt och supportande team.
* Bra balans mellan arbete och privatliv.
* Möjlighet att arbeta både från vårt fina kontor i Solna eller hemifrån.
* Att arbeta med vår moderna teknikstack med möjlighet att vara med och påverka.
* Utveckla dina tekniska färdigheter. Som ett exempel sponsrar vi dig för att bli AWS-certifierad.
* Ett jobb där värdet du levererar är viktigt för hundratusentals kunder och användare.
* Goda försäkrings- och tjänstepensionsvillkor.
* Friskvårdsbidrag och tillgång till kontoret Arkens gym och pool.
* Personalförmåner genom PostNords egen personalstiftelse PostNord Plus.


 Vi gör vardagen enklare
   

  

 PostNord är den ledande leverantören av kommunikations- och logistiklösningar till, från och inom Norden. Vi säkerställer postservicen till privatpersoner och företag i Sverige och Danmark. Vi strävar efter att göra vardagen enklare och mer hållbar för alla som bor och arbetar i Norden. Vi är ansvarstagande, modiga och engagerade, och leder effektivt förändring oavsett om vi leder oss själva eller andra. Vi uppmuntrar lagarbete, uppriktighet och positiva relationer på arbetsplatsen. Vi bygger vidare på våra framgångar och lär oss av både kollegor och misstag. Människor med olika bakgrund arbetar hos oss. Du kommer därför vara en del av en arbetsplats med stor mångfald, vilket bidrar till bättre resultat för verksamheten. Besök oss på postnord.com.
   

  

 Ansök
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan. Urval sker löpande så ansök så snart som möjligt. Om du undrar något avseende tjänsten, maila gustav.forsberg@postnord.com. Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig! På grund av semestertider kan handläggningstiden för ansökningar vara längre än vanligt.
   

  

 För fackliga kontaktpersoner se Facklig kontakt | PostNord

title: Database & SQL Coding Tutor
description:
Outlier helps the world’s most innovative companies improve their AI models by providing human feedback. Are you an experienced software engineer who would like to lend your coding expertise to train AI models?
   

  

 We partner with organizations to train AI large language models, helping cutting-edge generative AI models write better code. Projects typically include discrete, highly variable problems that involve engaging with these models as they learn to code. There is no requirement for previous AI experience.
   

  

**You must write Swedish for this specific AI training opportunity**
**About The Opportunity**
* Outlier is looking for talented coders to help train generative artificial intelligence models
* This freelance opportunity is remote and hours are flexible, so you can work whenever is best for you


**You may contribute your expertise by…**
* Crafting and answering questions related to computer science in order to help train AI models
* Evaluating and ranking code generated by AI models


**Examples Of Desirable Expertise**
* Ability to articulate complex concepts fluently in Swedish (required)
* Currently enrolled in or completed a bachelor's degree or higher in computer science at a selective institution
* Proficiency working with one or more of the the following languages: Java, Python, JavaScript / TypeScript, C++, Swift, and Verilog
* Excellent attention to detail, including grammar, punctuation, and style guidelines


**Payment**
* Currently, pay rates for core project work by coding experts range from USD $25 to $50 per hour.
* Rates vary based on expertise, skills assessment, location, project need, and other factors. For example, higher rates may be offered to PhDs. For non-core work, such as during initial project onboarding or project overtime phases, lower rates may apply. Certain projects offer incentive payments. Please review the payment terms for each project.


*PLEASE NOTE: We collect, retain and use personal data for our professional business purposes, including notifying you of opportunities that may be of interest and sharing with our affiliates. We limit the personal data we collect to that which we believe is appropriate and necessary to manage applicants’ needs, provide our services, and comply with applicable laws. Any information we collect in connection with your application will be treated in accordance with the* 
*Outlier Privacy Policy* 
*and our internal policies and programs designed to protect personal data.*
*This is a 1099 contract opportunity on the* 
*Outlier.ai* 
*platform. Because this is a freelance opportunity, we do not offer internships, sponsorship, or employment. You must be authorized to work in your country of residence. If you are an international student, you may be able to sign up for Outlier if you are on a visa. You should contact your tax and/or immigration advisor with specific questions regarding your circumstances.*

title: Praktikant systemutveckling .NET
description:
**Praktikant systemutveckling .NET** 




 Vill du få en inblick i hur Riksdagsförvaltningen arbetar agilt med att utveckla systemstöd som är anpassade för riksdagens och förvaltningens arbete?
 



  





 Riksdagsförvaltningen är en myndighet som har till uppgift att underlätta riksdagens arbete. Cirka 700 partipolitiskt neutrala medarbetare arbetar vid Riksdagsförvaltningen med många olika typer av arbetsuppgifter. Enheten it-utveckling erbjuder under höstterminen 2025 en praktikplats för en student.
 



  





**Dina arbetsuppgifter** 




 Vi erbjuder en praktikplats där du kommer att ingå i ett av våra utvecklingsteam. Du deltar i teamets arbete med både ny- och vidareutveckling samt förvaltning av egenutvecklade systemstöd. Som systemutvecklare hos oss utvecklar du backendlösningar i C# och Entity Framework samt skriver frontendkod i React och TypeScript.
 



  





**Dina kvalifikationer** 




 Vi söker dig som har ett stort teknikintresse, driv och engagemang. Du är inne i ett utbildningsprogram inom systemutveckling och har erfarenhet av C#, React och TypeScript från din utbildning. Det är en förutsättning att praktiken är poänggrundande och studiemedelsberättigande. Vi vill att du har möjlighet att praktisera i minst 10 veckor.
 



  





**Vi erbjuder dig** 




 Vi erbjuder dig en unik möjlighet till praktisk erfarenhet i ett team där du får jobba tillsammans med kunniga kollegor i det vardagliga arbetet. Vår utvecklingsenhet består av 50 personer som i olika roller arbetar med systemutveckling och systemförvaltning. Vi arbetar i ett öppet landskap i fräscha lokaler centralt i Stockholm, men du har också möjlighet att arbeta en del av din tid på distans.
 



  





 Vi har ett väl genomarbetat praktikprogram och du kommer tillsammans med andra praktikanter i Riksdagsförvaltningen att lära känna förvaltningens olika verksamheter. Praktiken är ingen anställning. Riksdagsförvaltningen betalar inte ut någon ersättning.
 



  





 Svenskt medborgarskap och godkänd säkerhetsprövning krävs eftersom praktiken genomförs i säkerhetsklassad verksamhet.
 



  





**Ansökan** 




 Ansök via www.riksdagen.se, senast den 30 mars 2025.
 



 Referensnummer: 1172-2024/25
 



  





 I brevet vill vi att du motiverar varför du vill göra praktik hos oss och beskriver ditt intresse för utveckling och teknik. Det ska också framgå av din ansökan att du får högskolepoäng eller yrkeshögskolepoäng för praktiken och att den är studiemedelsgrundande. Bifoga cv och resultatintyg från universitet, högskola eller yrkeshögskola för din pågående utbildning.
 



  





**Övrigt** 




 Riksdagsförvaltningen har gjort sitt medieval för rekrytering och undanber
 



 sig alla erbjudanden om annonserings- och rekryteringshjälp i samband
 



 med denna annons.
 



  





**Kontakta oss** 



* Henrik Vikström, lead developer, henrik.vikstrom@riksdagen.se
* Johanna Back, enhetschef, 08-786 68 88

title: Senior Data Engineer AWS
description:
Trustly is leading the human-centric payments revolution. To us, this means passionately building the most convenient, intelligent and responsible way of paying for things online. Whether it’s for shopping, paying subscriptions, funding trading accounts, booking airfare, playing online games and much more – we’re all about a better way to pay. At our core, we are a tech company with industry-leading tech capabilities. But, it’s the ingenuity of our people that makes us leaders in our field. Thus, our appetite for innovation will never be anything less than fierce. Trustly is steadily growing as it connects thousands of businesses with hundreds of millions of people. And with a strong presence across Europe and the Americas, we are leading the human-centric payment revolution as a truly global team.
 




  





**About the Data domain
 





 The Data domain’s mission is to transform Trustly into a truly data-driven organization. We are responsible for every aspect of the data journey, from collection & modeling to analysis and visualization. We provide the whole organization with data and analytics artifacts aiming to improve our decisions, operations and the customer’s experience.
 









 We are currently building a new Data Platform on AWS.
 








**About the role
 





 As Trustly is currently moving towards micro-services we have identified the need of a new data platform, a data hub to cater for operational data needs.
 









 Together with the Data Platform team, you will actively participate in the implementation and the maintenance for this new data platform based on AWS. The goal is to design and build a strong and reliable data foundation that will initially support operational data exchanges and will gradually support our analytics and machine learning use cases.
 





  




**What you’ll do** 
* Design and develop Trustly’s Data Platform on AWS
* Build and maintain batch and streaming data pipelines from internal as well as external data producers
* Work with transformations of data from one or multiple source systems to feed our downstream applications
* Optimize data processes for efficiency and scalabilityImplement data security measures and access controls to protect sensitive information
* Participate in data governance and compliance efforts to meet regulatory requirements
* Provide technical expertise and guidance for critical data projects
* Continuously optimize data architecture to support Trustly's evolving data needs
* Help us identify new use-cases for our data and collaborate with stakeholders from the rest of the organization on how to realize those



  




**Who you are** 
* A Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering or similar field
* At least 7 years of experience as a data engineer/data architect
* Proficient in designing and building complex data pipelines and data processing systems
* Experienced with SQL/NoSQL databases (PostgreSQL, Redshift, MongoDB)
* Proficient in building stream processing systems using Kafka
* Accustomed of data governance principles, ensuring data quality, security, and compliance
* Experienced with cloud platforms such as AWS or GCP
* Proficient in Python, SQL, dbt, Airflow, Airbyte, S3, Hudi, Athena, Kubernetes and CI/CD process
* Familiar with self-service reporting and machine learning use cases and their prerequisites in terms of data infrastructure
* Thrive in a fast growing company






  




  






  






 Are you someone who voices new ideas and acts on them? Do you value great communication with all stakeholders? We are looking to strengthen the team with dedicated, highly motivated people who thrive in working with different areas across the organisation.
 









 If you feel that your skill set and personality compliments the criteria above, apply now and k
 

 indly submit your CV in English.****

title: Verification Engineer
company_industry: Hospitals and Health Care, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Software Development
description:
**We don’t just build technology. We build hope.**
 At Elekta, we make a difference by leading the way in precision radiation therapy. We’re dedicated to ensuring everyone has access to the best cancer care possible. Are you as passionate about our mission and innovation as we are? Then we would love to meet you!
   

  

 We’re looking for two
 **Mechanical Verification Engineers** 
 to join our R&D team within the Neuro Business Line, offering opportunities for both recent graduates and experienced professionals. This position is located at Elekta’s new head office at the heart of Hagastaden in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

**What You’ll Do At Elekta**
 You will be a part of a scrum team that specifies, develops and tests products for stereotactic neurosurgery in an R&D organization and works according to the SAFe agile methodology. The team’s goal is to develop and maintain precise, safe and compliant hardware devices and systems.
   

  

 All mechanics, electronics and software are developed and verified in the Stockholm office.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 As a Mechanical Verification Engineer at Elekta your primary responsibility will be mechanical verification and continuous test of Leksell Gamma Knife® and the Leksell® Vantage™ Stereotactic System (please check the links to check these products you’ll help verify). In short, Leksell Gamma Knife is a non-invasive, precision stereotactic treatment device used to deliver focused radiation to intercranial targets. Leksell® Vantage™ Stereotactic System is minimally invasive system for neurosurgery.
   

  

 You will work in close cooperation with other team members to contribute to:
   

  

* Prototype testing & design improvement: collaborate closely with team members to test prototypes, identify defects, and suggest design enhancements early in the development phase.
* Verification & reporting: write test specifications, execute verification activities, and thoroughly document and report results.
* Process & product improvements: participate in risk analysis, review of requirements, design drawings, related documents and selecting and validating tools.


 This will require that you collaborate with many other stakeholders e.g. within system, control system, mechanics, quality, procurement, and production. We expect you to continuously strive to improve both process efficiency and product quality.
   

  

 At Elekta we are passionate about developing our products, and we need to make sure that our deliveries are of exceptional quality.
   

  

**What You’ll Bring With You**
 We are looking for a highly motivated and quality-oriented team player with a hands-on approach and a passion for innovation. We hope that you are ready to take the initiative, and that you have a structured and analytical approach to solving problems regardless of your level of previous experience. To be successful in the role, we believe you:
   

  

* Have work experience or interest in the role of Verification Engineer or working with medical devices
* Have a relevant University education such as Mechanical, Material or Medical Engineering or Physics
* Enjoy working in an Agile cross functional team
* Able to see the bigger picture while focusing on detailed tasks.


 If you are familiar with working with tools such as portable measurement arms, coordinate measuring machines, 3D printing or automation using robotics, that’s valuable strength.
   

  

**Why should you join Elekta?**
 In this role, you will work for a higher purpose: hope for everyone dealing with cancer and for everyone, regardless of where they are in the world, to have access to the best cancer care. Additionally, our benefit package includes:
   

  

* 30 paid vacation days/year, additional 4 Elekta days off /year (plus bank holidays).
* Attractive defined contribution pension scheme.
* Private Medical Insurance.
* Lunch Benefit.
* Contribution to wellness activities.
* Hybrid work option (you are required to work on location at least 3 days a week).


**Hiring process**
 We look forward to hearing from you! Please submit your application in English via the 'Apply' button. Applications will be reviewed on an ongoing basis until the deadline on the
 **31st of March 2025** 
 .
   

  

 For questions regarding the role or special assistance, please contact the responsible TA Partner Maria Strelkova at maria.strelkova@elekta.com. Please note that we don’t accept applications or provide individual application feedback via e-mail.
   

  

**We are an equal opportunity employer**
 We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other status protected by law in the locations where Elekta operates.
   

  

**About Elekta**
 As a leader in precision radiation therapy, Elekta is committed to ensuring every patient has access to the best cancer care possible. Elekta is a proud innovator and supplier of equipment and software used to improve, prolong, and save the lives of people with cancer and brain disorders.
   

  

 More than 6,000 hospitals worldwide rely on Elekta technology. We openly collaborate with customers to advance sustainable, outcome-driven, and cost-efficient solutions to meet evolving patient needs, improve lives and bring hope to everyone dealing with cancer. To us, it's personal, and our global team of 4,700 employees combine passion, science, and imagination to profoundly change cancer care. We don’t just build technology, we build hope.
   

  

 Elekta is headquartered in Stockholm, Sweden, with presence in more than 120 markets and listed on Nasdaq Stockholm. For more information about opportunities at Elekta, please visit elekta.com/company/careers.

title: Open Source Senior Software Engineer - OpenTelemetry Agent
description:
The Datadog Agent is software that runs on customer infrastructure and supports a wide range of platforms. It efficiently collects observability data from millions of hosts and sends them to Datadog, where our customers can analyze their monitoring and performance data. OpenTelemetry (OTel) is an open source, vendor-neutral observability solution that allows teams to monitor their applications and services in a standardized format.
   

  

 We are looking for an experienced Software Engineer who will help us ensure that OpenTelemetry users deploying the open-source Datadog Agent can get access to all of Datadog's industry-leading observability solutions and can continue to leverage OpenTelemetry-specific capabilities (via the embedded OTel Collector). Come join us to unlock new observability capabilities across millions of Agents, for technical customers who care deeply about what you build.
   

  

*At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them.*
**What You’ll Do:**
* Develop high-performance OTel observability pipelines in the Datadog Agent, running on customers’ infrastructures and targeting a large number of platforms / environments / deployment models, with Datadog-specific and upstream OpenTelemetry contributions
* Simplify customers’ onboarding and management of OTel pipelines with Fleet Management capabilities
* Review community contributions to Datadog-related components of OTel
* Take part in investigating and fixing issues with the internal production deployment of the Datadog Agent
* With your team, be a driving force in product decisions and plan the most important projects to work on next


**Who You Are:**
* You have been building software for 5+ years and know the systems you’ve worked on from top to bottom
* You have significant experience in one or more programming languages such as Go, Java, Rust, .NET or C/C++
* You value code simplicity and performance
* You are data driven and use observability products
* You want to work in a fast, high-growth environment that respects its engineers and customers
* You are motivated by solving problems for our customers


*Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply.*
**Bonus Points:**
* You have experience building and shipping packaged or downloadable software
* You are familiar with OpenTelemetry
* You have contributed to or have an official role in Open Source projects
* You have significant experience in using profilers, debuggers, tracers, or similar tools to improve the code quality of the software you’re writing


**Benefits and Growth:**
* New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan (ESPP)
* Continuous professional development, product training, and career pathing
* Intradepartmental mentor and buddy program for in-house networking
* An inclusive company culture, ability to join our Community Guilds (Datadog employee resource groups)
* Access to Inclusion Talks, our internal panel discussions
* Free, global mental health benefits for employees and dependents age 6+
* Competitive global benefits


*Benefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog.*
**About Datadog:**
 Datadog (NASDAQ: DDOG) is a global SaaS business, delivering a rare combination of growth and profitability. We are on a mission to break down silos and solve complexity in the cloud age by enabling digital transformation, cloud migration, and infrastructure monitoring of our customers’ entire technology stacks. Built by engineers, for engineers, Datadog is used by organizations of all sizes across a wide range of industries. Together, we champion professional development, diversity of thought, innovation, and work excellence to empower continuous growth. Join the pack and become part of a collaborative, pragmatic, and thoughtful people-first community where we solve tough problems, take smart risks, and celebrate one another. Learn more about #DatadogLife on Instagram, LinkedIn, and Datadog Learning Center.
   

  

**Equal Opportunity at Datadog:**
 Datadog is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and is proud to offer equal employment opportunity to everyone regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, veteran status, and more. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. Here are our Candidate Legal Notices for your reference.
   

  

**Your Privacy:**
 Any information you submit to Datadog as part of your application will be processed in accordance with Datadog’s Applicant and Candidate Privacy Notice.

title: Testautomatiseringsingengör - Tietoevry Tech Services (m/f/d)
description:
**You may apply to Tietoevry by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.**
 Har du en bred teknisk bakgrund, passion för problemlösning och vill ansluta dig till ett av Nordens största Tech-företag? Vi söker en Test automation specialist som vill bli en del av Tietoevry Tech Services. Tietoevry Tech Services driver företagsomfattande transformationer av kundernas affärsprocesser, applikationer och infrastruktur.
   

  

 Vårt testteam fortsätter att växa och nu söker vi fler specialister inom test och kvalitetssäkring för spännande konsultuppdrag. Har du stort intresse för testautomatisering, gillar konsultrollen och omväxling samt tycker det är kul att vara en del av ett team där vi aktivt delar med oss av kunskaper inom våra kompetensområden? Bli en av oss!
   

  

**När du börjar på Tietoevry Tech Services som testautomatiseringsingengör kommer du:**
* Att arbeta huvudsakligen självständigt men inom ett testteam med att designa och underhålla automatiserade tester, skapa testskript, exekvera och rapportera resultatet.
* Vårt team arbetar med kvalitetssäkring i alla typer av branscher. Vi har bland annat kunder inom finansbranschen, offentlig sektor, detaljhandeln och tillverkningssektorn. Som konsult hos oss kommer du växla mellan att sitta ute hos kund och arbeta i deras interna projekt och att ingå i någon av våra helhetsåtaganden där leveransteamen ofta jobbar inom agila metoder och DevOps med automatiserade testprocesser.
* Uppdragens omfattning varierar och kan vara både nyutvecklingsprojekt och övergångsprojekt. Oavsett ditt uppdrag kommer du alltid att vara en del av Tietoevrys testcommunity, som består av mer än 1000 kvalitetssäkringspersonal över hela världen.


**Vem vi söker:**
* Du är svensk medborgare och pratar flytande svenska samt engelska
* Du har några års arbetslivserfarenhet inom testautomationsområdet och kunskap av olika testautomatiserings ramverk och testautomatiseringsprocesser
* Kunskap och erfarenheter av testautomatisering inom Agilt och DevOps-miljöer
* Kunskap inom ett eller flera av följande verktyg och områden: Robot Framework, Java/Selenium, UFT, Playwright eller liknande


 Eftersom du kommer att jobba nära våra kunder i konsultuppdrag så tror vi att du är en social, och analytisk person som gillar att arbeta i en roll där tempot är högt och där arbetsuppgifterna snabbt kan förändras. Vi tror också att du har god kommunikationsförmåga, uppskattar att arbeta i team och att du gärna delar med dig av dina kunskaper samtidigt som du också kan arbeta självständigt och fokuserat när så krävs.
   

  

**Det är meriterande om du också har:**
* Certifiering (ISTQB Foundation level eller högre/liknande)
* Kunskaper inom Continuous Integration Testing
* Tidigare arbetat inom telecom, finansiella sektorn, säkerhetsbranschen eller offentlig sektor
* Kunskaper i programmeringsspråk, exempelvis Phyton, Java, .NET


**Vi erbjuder**
 Vi erbjuder dig professionell tillväxt, meningsfulla projekt, öppen kultur och en enastående balans mellan arbete och privatliv! Vi erbjuder dig en möjlighet att skapa framtiden för en snabbt växande och viktig sektor. Vi tror att vår organisationskultur är en viktig del för att du ska bli framgångsrik. Vi tillhandahåller en flexibel hybrid arbetsmodell som en del av vår kultur och vårt sätt att arbeta. Slutligen tror vi också på nyfikenhet och konstant lärande som en livsstil där du behöver skola om dig varje dag när nya möjligheter dyker upp.
   

  

**Fick vi dig inspirererad?**
 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

 Bifoga ditt CV eller LinkedIn-profil så kontaktar vi dig. Intervjuer kommer att hållas löpande, så vi uppmanar dig att söka redan idag. Om du har några frågor angående denna roll, vänligen kontakta anställande chef, saeid.mojtahedzadeh@tietoevry.com.
   

  

 Hoppas vi hörs snart!
   

  

*Vi utför bakgrundskontroller av alla slutkandidater.*
*Tietoevry tackar nej till samtal från rekryteringsföretag.*
*Tietoevry värdesätter mångfald och vi välkomnar sökande av alla kön, åldrar, förmågor, etniciteter, inriktningar, övertygelser och bakgrunder.*
**Om Tietoevry**
 Tietoevry skapar målmedveten teknik som återuppfinner världen för gott. Vi är ett ledande teknikföretag med ett starkt nordiskt arv och global kapacitet. Utifrån våra kärnvärderingar öppenhet, tillit och mångfald, arbetar vi med våra kunder för att utveckla digitala framtider där företag, samhällen och mänskligheten frodas.
   

  

 Våra 24 000 experter globalt är specialiserade på moln, data samt mjukvara och bistår tusentals företagskunder och offentliga kunder i mer än 90 länder. Tietoevrys årliga omsättning är cirka 3 miljarder euro och bolagets aktier är noterade på NASDAQ-börsen i Helsingfors och Stockholm samt på Oslo Børs. Bekanta dig med vad vi gör.
   

  

*Skapar målmedveten teknik för att återuppfinna världen för gott*
 At Tietoevry, we believe in the power of diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, genders (m/f/d), and walks of life to join our team, as we believe that this fosters an inspiring workplace and fuels innovation. Our commitment to openness, trust, and diversity is at the heart of our mission to create digital futures that benefit businesses, societies, and humanity. Diversity, equity and inclusion (tietoevry.com)

title: Senior Workplace Engineer, Enheter och Applikationer, Solna
company_industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage
description:
Vill du vara en del av en dynamisk och snabbt föränderlig miljö på PostNord IT Workplace-avdelning? Om du har erfarenhet och bakgrund som Tech lead eller lösningsarkitekt för arbetsplatsenheter och applikationer, är detta jobb för dig!
   

  

 Bli en del av oss
   

  

 Workplace-avdelningen har idag cirka 15 teammedlemmar som ansvarar för PostNords IT-arbetsplats för både administrativ och produktionspersonal. IT Arbetsplatsen är under ständig utveckling och vi strävar alltid efter säkra, pålitliga och användarvänliga tjänster. I vårt arbete håller vi kontinuerligt ett öga på PostNords övergripande vision och strategier för att säkerställa att IT Arbetsplatsen möjliggör och stödjer företagets marknadspositionering.
   

  

 Arbetsuppgifter
   

  

**Design Och Strategi**
 I rollen som Senior Workplace Engineer med fokus på enheter och applikationer, kommer du att arbeta med både interna kollegor och externa leverantörer. Rollen innebär bland annat att arbeta med:
   

  

* Samarbeta med service managers och andra intressenter för att förstå affärskrav och mål.
* Utveckla strategier och framtidsplaner för plattformar, enheter och applikationer för att forma en modern och pålitlig arbetsplats.
* Designa och föreslå tekniska lösningar för tjänster såsom Citrix, applikationshantering, Intune, utskriftshantering, övervakning av användarupplevelsen mm.
* Utvärdera och rekommendera nya teknologier och branschpraxis för att förbättra IT arbetsplatsen.


**Lösningsrådgivning Och Optimering**
* Leda implementering av design, säkerställa efterlevnad av etablerade standarder och bästa praxis.
* Samarbeta med tvärfunktionella team för att integrera lösningar med IT Arbetsplatsen.
* Rådgivning om konfiguration och optimering av Citrix, Intune och andra relevanta teknologier för att säkerställa sömlös prestanda.


**Intressentsamarbete Och Kommunikation**
* Ge expertvägledning och konsultation till service manager och produktägare angående arkitektoniska och tekniska beslut.
* Samarbeta med intressenter för att förstå deras behov och översätta dem till konkreta tekniska krav.
* Hålla regelbundna möten, workshops och presentationer för att kommunicera arkitektoniska koncept och rekommendationer.
* Bygga starka relationer med interna team, leverantörer och partners för att säkerställa framgångsrika outsourcade implementeringar.


**Dokumentation Och Rapportering**
* Skapa och underhålla dokumentation av arkitektoniska designer, konfigurationer och processer.
* Dokumentera lärdomar, bästa praxis och riktlinjer för arbetsplatsmiljön för enheter och applikationer.


 ,
   

  

**Vi Söker Dig Som Har**
* Kandidatexamen i datavetenskap, informationsteknik eller relaterat område, eller motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet.
* Minst tre års erfarenhet som tech lead eller lösningsarkitekt inom IT arbetsplats med fokus på enheter och applikationstjänster, helst i en stor och komplex affärsmiljö.
* Stark teknisk expertis inom Citrix, Intune, applikationshantering, utskriftshantering och övervakning av användarupplevelsen.
* Erfarenhet av outsourcade arbetsmiljöer och förmåga att effektivt samarbeta på distans.
* Kunskap om agila metoder är mycket önskvärt.
* Stark problemlösnings- och analytisk förmåga.
* Utmärkta kommunikations- och interpersonella färdigheter för att effektivt samarbeta med intressenter på alla nivåer.
* Förmåga att arbeta självständigt och leverera resultat inom angivna tidsramar.
* Relevanta certifieringar (t.ex. Citrix Certified Expert - Virtualization, Microsoft Certified: Enterprise Administrator Expert) är ett plus.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med ITIL-processer och ramverk.
* Svenska och engelska, flytande i tal och skrift.


 Vi tror att du är en person som redan har ett stort intresse för arbetsplatsenheter och applikationer. Ditt arbetssätt är inkluderande, strukturerat och ansvarsfullt. Du är kommunikativ, lätt att samarbeta med och säkerställer att ditt arbetssätt skapar och vårdar långsiktiga relationer.
   

  

 Vi erbjuder dig
   

  

 Vi Erbjuder En Roll Som En Del Av Vårt Dynamiska Team Som Inkluderar Tjänsteansvariga, Ingenjörer Och En Chefsarkitekt. Roller Inom Workplace Är Dedikerade Till Vissa Lösningsområden Och Ansvarar För Att Styra Outsourcade Arbetsplatstjänster Och/eller Några Av De Internt Hanterade Tjänsterna. Det Dagliga Arbetet Varierar i En Internationell Miljö Med Ständigt Nya Utmaningar Och Snabba Beslut. Här Har Du Möjligheter Att Utveckla Kreativa Lösningar Och Arbeta i En Prestigelös Grupp Där Vi Gemensamt Hjälper Till Att Nå Våra Mål. PostNord Är En Av Sveriges Största Arbetsplatser Och Vi Erbjuder Trygga Anställningsvillkor Och Förmåner. Utöver De Förmåner Som Nämns Ovan Erbjuder Vi
   

  

* Hybrid arbetsplats med en nordisk och dynamisk miljö. Se videon om vårt kontor.
* Stora utvecklingsmöjligheter
* Bra försäkrings- och pensionsvillkor
* Friskvårdsbidrag och möjlighet att träna på Arkens gym och inomhuspool
* Medarbetarförmåner genom PostNord Plus - PostNords egen personalstiftelse


 Vi gör vardagen enklare
   

  

 PostNord är den ledande leverantören av kommunikations- och logistiklösningar till, från och inom Norden. Vi säkerställer tillhandahållandet av posttjänster till hushåll och företag i Sverige och Danmark. Vi strävar efter att göra vardagen enklare och mer hållbar för alla som bor och arbetar i Norden. Vi är i ständig omvandling och arbetar konsekvent för att utveckla både vårt erbjudande och våra medarbetare, allt för att uppnå vår vision att vara Nordens favorittransportör. Vi är PostNord - ett fantastiskt företag att arbeta och växa med. Läs mer på postnord.com
